GOd2C65UjKI1LVGnEhN7WQ.text: I can't even try an all you can eat Korean in Austin! Hands down! Hwaro was very authentic and you get your bang for your bucks! All the meats we ordered were so flavorful and great portions! Our waiter was so helpful and very accommodating. Great service, great food and great company! I will be visiting this place when I'm back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

RSGroNpdl38POK1sqyTsUA.text: this is my first time visiting vegas with some friends and we luckily got sat with Boo. he was a really nice waiter and attentive the entire time. he also gave us suggestions when we didn't know what was good on the menu. he was a great waiter! make the table feel very welcomed and friendly.  thank you Boo!!

i6nz-g3xwlhS8KePHd-W4Q.text: Before arriving here i called to see if there was rice paper & they said there was some, upon arrival we never got it and i asked literally more than 8 times for the damn rice paper the wait took awhile but even after being seated they took forever to give us are food and when we would order more side dishes it was a longer wait I'm talking about simple bowl of white rice . I don't recommend it better spots in vegas but we wanted to try something new . Will not be back save your money.

uioaYycFH0c82P4FD3fahg.text: Absolutely and positively the most scrumptious place of pristine dining this side of the Mississippi and I'll have you know I am a fat ass so this place is legit af

BL2dF4osStGzyE-SWjgj_A.text: There are better Alternatives out there. Better price better food better service .We  just found their food average. Along with that we had a speaker 5 ft from our heads that blasted us out the whole time we were eating. Not the way for you to enjoy your meal

uvA6R5g432qmUjNC5GbzGg.text: Everything was great except that random staff that would come over and adjust the flame on the grill. Our server was attentive and friendly. Kpop bangers playing inside the restaurant, which I enjoyed. Hardly any wait time to be seated. I'll definitely be returning

GQ0FxG52OCfuEy1MrntGVg.text: This place is open late & the quality of food is pretty good. It's a good price for AYCE. Their service got a lot better too. From the time we come in to put our name on the paper to the time we left, it was great! We got what we needed right away. The only downfall is the wait time. It's like super long. But, that just means that it's good.   Get the shake shake rice! & the SHIT. They're good.

yMwC9zwwiAsqah4WtRCTDw.text: Favorite AYCE Korean BBQ in Vegas! I'm happy a cousin of mine who recently moved to Vegas put me on to this place. It really is a hidden gem. The service was great, the food was amazing and the drinks were equally up to par. I really enjoyed their jalapeno beef belly. Must try! I also liked that they offer ice cream at the end, as I find, most ayce Korean places do not offer desert with the meal price. I will also say all of their cuts of meat are high quality and they don't skimp out on sides and sauces. I really enjoyed the garlic butter. I'm so happy I got this recommendation from a local because I wanna as not steered wrong. There is no way I would come visit Vegas again and not bring all my friend here.  I will say my one tip is to wear comfortable clothing as sitting for a while in a room radiating all that heat can get a little sticky. But, I promise the food is so worth it you will not fret over anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

TZiEbjvGsiGIngv4ACyR6w.text: This is one of the best kbbq in town! I love how they have a great selection of meat, sides and appetizers. The staff is very friendly and also very attentive. We always order the brisket and skirt steak! It's soooo good! Among all the kbbq places I've been at this place has the best dipping sauce for the meat and best kimchi as well. The only reason why I took 1 star off is because some of their all day special menu you can only get one piece. So that's a bummer. But we always come back to this place because of how good the food is! Highly recommend!

cJYP-4uRCHaqXIcUPsdU7g.text: Me and my family came here on a Tuesday night around 10pm and waited about 10 minutes for a table . They have this late night special for $20 after 10pm and military/government discount which is something you cannot pass over and instantly made me already like this place! I grew up in the 626 Los Angeles area and have tried multiple Korean bbq areas in ktown so coming to a Korean bbq in an area not known for Korean bbq...my expectations were not very high. Also to note the last time I ate Korean bbq I got food poisoning so I really doubted even going to another one. However that being said, Hwaro blew away all of me and my family's expectations. The side dishes were really fresh, meat selection had more than enough to choose from (pork cheek usually is not on my "to eat" list but somehow it was here!!!), corn cheese was super bomb that I ended up ordering like 6 lol, and did I mention they have vanilla/green tea/strawberry ice cream?! The ice cream actually pushed me to write this review because I really dislike green tea ice cream in general and strawberry is my favorite flavor, so you can imagine my face when I didn't even notice the desert options until the end! If I ever come back to Vegas again this will be a regular stop for me. Also our server was Yvette, she was super cute and also very attentive in switching out the grills and taking our reorders. I'm sure the rest of the staff is just as good from what I've read on yelp, so pair that with the excellent food experience and you get 5 stars!

d_x7g6_M3ljrKt6AlNE4qA.text: The salt n oil sauce was amazing!!  The fish cake was super delicious.   This place does not have rice paper

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Fish cake

Zhts39ehxfrpMoNuYvdEfA.text: I did not expect such a quality experience for the price.   Please note, I'm comparing HWARO to barbeque restaurants I've dined in Korea, and it starts with the KIMCHI! It's certainly a different taste than others I've tried as its more mild, but I enjoy it. They gave us plenty for our table of 7 and were quick to resupply.   Roughly 50 cuts of meat and seafood are available,  and although I stuck with mostly the beef dishes I didn't find any problems with them. "The S**t" is surprisingly good too, give it a shot.   The staff was must accommodating,  too, but I won't go into the details on that one ;). Excellent service,  we thank you once again!

OgOYvK0ZJlS0Y8EK6WZbug.text: My food prayers have been answered! There's a new KBBQ place in town and for $19.99 AYCE dinner. Heck yeah! The couple my husband and I usually dine with decided to go for lunch. Lunch is $16.99 but for $3 extra per person, we decided to splurge (LOL) and get the dinner AYCE. We looked at the menu and when we ordered, we discovered that one of our menus had tape over some of the items to indicate they were no longer available. The BOGO free beer was a tease, no free desserts included & no green tea smoked pork belly. :( This is minor but they were out of Hite beer but they had Cass beer. I know some of my peeps might care about that so I thought I would mention that.  It's your standard AYCE KBBQ place, you start off with sangchu geotjeori (Korean lettuce salad), a wide assortment of banchan (side dishes), sauces & sides for your meat-sesame oil dip, spicy chili dip, ssamjang, garlic cloves, and jalapenos. Looking at other photos from people who have went before me, I was disappointed to not get the some of my favorite banchan. In one of the photos, they received more banchan. They don't usually include corn cheese but I didn't get that either!! WTF!  Meats: Our group ordered the brisket, pork belly, short ribs, flank steak, bulgogi, and baby octopus (they were out of baby octopus so they substituted it with squid which was fine with us). No major complaints. Good enough. The chadol and pork belly were thick and good. Galbi was my least favorite.  Also included was your typical doenjang chigae (fermented soybean paste stew). It had a good flavor but it was missing tofu. I don't remember having this stew without tofu. The gyeran jjim (steamed egg casserole) was terrible! No scallions, it was bland, and had a burnt aftertaste.  Service could be better. She didn't ask if we wanted more banchan nor helped us with the meat (not that I need it but it's nice when they do). Overall, it's still a steal for $20 when the other KBBQ places in this town charge $25-$33. I was disappointed to not get a lot of the items in the photos but can't really complain too much when it's $19.99.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Pumpkin Sikhye
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Doenjang Chigae (fermented soybean paste stew) &amp; Gyeran Jjim (steamed egg casserole).
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Chadol (Brisket) &amp; Samgyupsal (pork belly).

3tOi9ywNcLihFf84QAaCHQ.text: I really like the service and the great quality of the food for the pricing. The server is constantly looking and making sure we are helped which helps a lot and they have not taken more than 5 min to bring something out. I definitely recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

VhBbRjkAp1-7bjC8JGAckA.text: We were driving home from Zion, Utah & was starving from all the hiking! It was a Sunday night around 7/8pm and the wait was an hour :( it seem to be very popular, because there's not a lot of ayce in Vegas. We got seated& our waiter was very prompt with everything. I LOVE the menu, it had such a wide variety of items & items you usually don't see on ayce Korean BBQ menus. Such as ; corn cheese, gyoza, seaweed, buglogi nachos. They even had different types of sauces, soup & garlic butter! Everything was good, including the sides. It was $21 for dinner & I would definitely come back here if I'm in the area. Wished they would open one up here in California!!

UHxjOt8xsqJt6qI7fEP0iw.text: This place is never make me disappointed. We order the same menu that we usually have which are beef frank, beef tougue and pork belly. But we try your spick pork. It kind of salty. And taco is also salty. Other things was great.

KkYRGuT6LGqav9LgKOAQiQ.text: This place is Ayce and the price can not be beat! Parking can be a pain. And to get a table can be a LONG wait. My family came for a Christmas celebration and we called to rsvp. My one complaint is that it was way too loud. I had to yell at my husband sitting next to me about everything, and it was near impossible to talk to the person in front of you. My party was large and we had 10 people. They waiters seemed overwhelmed and my family just cooked, it's OK though, we're Korean. The sides were really good. The meat was good, not the highest highest quality but $20 ayce? You just can't beat it. Be prepared to order quick, and do not over order as they will charge you!

FYkQzwiSARB2h4kVc9nXKQ.text: It was very first time at Hwaro. I never knew that it's AYCE. It was really cheap, delicious. Servers were nice

UR73nivMuYhASS2TxtYwTQ.text: Fast service and good food. They make no reservations, make sure to arrive with the entire party to get seated. Garlic butter on steak is good pretty much on everything bbq. Meat selection is good and there is good table space for a lot of plates. A little warm inside the restaurant.

4iQtcsETrha0_68AIQWIlw.text: Customer service is huge for me. My family and I waited 2 hours. No problem. I went to check our spot on the list, we were next. The hostess comes out and calls my name, I said "right here" loud enough for other people to see also. The hostess seated TWO parties way further down the list. When I asked what was up, she straight up said "well you didn't say anything". Had I not asked her, she would have proceeded to continue skipping over us. Not to mention, she had been calling out names the entire night to see who was all waiting still. So she had seen and called me twice prior to this.   Food was good. Service sucked hard. Put a bad taste in my mouth to begin with so I didn't get to enjoy it as much as I wanted to.

0C54IMqVeeTeQXmY4uTqaA.text: I'm giving Hwaro five stars because that was the best meal I've had in a long time. We arrived on a Friday night at dinner time without a reservation and had to add our name to the waiting list. For 2 hours we sat outside because I had read other reviews and really wanted to try Hwaro. We were only in town for 2 days and since we live in MS where there are NO Korean restaurants, I needed my kbbq fix.  Once we were seated the server brought out menus and banchan really quickly. A beautiful selection of savory, sweet, salty, crunchy sides to compliment quite a large variety of meats to grill. We opted for the 20.95 "All Day" menu. Choose from anything off the menu except two categories. Amazing. The doenjjang jigge is a must-try and even better than some that I've had in Korea. The steamed egg was silky smooth and fluffy. They are generous with the meat and changed the grill out often to prevent it from sticking/burning. Over all, the staff was very attentive and I could tell that they want their customers to have the best experience. I haven't tried any other Korean restaurants in the area but I think I'll stick with Hwaro when I come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

RUXDOZyO8UvzZ8L-XT5oZw.text: Super good food!!!! Must try!!! And free beer with a review! Huge selection of food and side dishes. Parking is difficult but worth it. Try the short ribs. Tongue. And premium steak. Well worth the 20.95 price.

H6wAl957VaDB2eyRA-bnOw.text: Quality of meats is average, but for $20 you have a huge selection of meats and other non bbq dishes- it's a reallyyyy extensive menu.   The space is small, there were maybe... 8 tables that sit 4/5 people, and 2 large tables for larger parties. We had a party of 4 and the wait was ~30-45 min. Definitely wouldn't come here with a huge party. The 2 older korean women who were the hosts and likely the owners weren't the friendliest, either.   Service was pretty terrible. We had to ask numerous times for some of our orders.   Would I come here again? ehhh.. for the long wait time, subpar quality of meats, and poor service- I'm hesitant. It's saving grace is the fact that it's $20 and has such a large selection of items on the menu.

OdUsp13Ub_nTKh-N4XE6Iw.text: Amazing food. One of the best Korean spots in Vegas . Have always come here after the first time very happy with service and everything

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Amazing!!

dzZPF7tn8bazhNFBmzfnDw.text: The price is right! $19.99 AYCE Korean BBQ that has a great selection of ban chan (side dishes) and a decent selection of meats.    Meats by ranking: Short rib - really tender Hwaro (thin) pork belly Rib eye Spicy chicken Pork belly Brisket Flank steak Pork skin (probably pass next time) Tripe (aka intestine) - also pass  Ban chan: Cheesy corn - I don't know of any other Vegas kbbq places with this side Korean spicy rice cake Steamed egg Picked radish, cucumbers Dried fish Chap chae Veggie Korean pancake Broccoli with creamy sauce  Based on the photos, the ban chan must change daily. I was sad to see that there were no bean sprouts or fish cake today :( I was also hoping they would have the Korean rice paper since no Vegas establishment seems to carry this side.  Negatives: limited seafood options, but what can you really expect for the price. Also as mentioned previously, no beef tongue...which is usually a fan favorite. I would suggest having different prices for additional offerings like most Cali places offer in case you want to upgrade. We were offered two grills for seven people but it would have been an awkward setup. Their larger tables for 8 only have one grill.  Positive - the service was excellent and very attentive. I like that they allow half orders so you can sample the items that you are unsure about. They have no limitations on how many orders of short rib per table. Most of the time the meat was cooked and cut for us.  The grills were changed at least 5-6 times.  Overall for the price, service, and quality of food, will definitely be back.  I have a feeling that prices will probably increase with time as other establishments have, so come get it while you can!

VD9yUdoWU92nnocxoFFczA.text: Couldn't wait for the long line at Caesar's buffet. Thought we give this ACYE a try.   Food - average. Flavor is not bad but can be better.   Short rib - definitely can use more flavor. It's cut too thick. Average quality.   Beef belly - pretty good. A bit fatty.   Brisket - my least favorite. Quality is ehh.   Fat ass (yes, that's the name) - it's basically a very fatty thick cut pork belly marinated in a wine sauce. Kinda bland. Very fatty. Ehh.   Steam eggs - complimentary. We ordered this when we ordered our food but they must have forgotten. We had to ask mid way through our dinner n didn't receive it till all of our food was cooked. Would have loved this to help balance our fatty meal. Flavor was good. Very eggy. Egg ratio was higher than the broth.   Banchan - ehh. Very average. U get about 8 or so banchan with ur meal + a salad. Soy bean soup is also included but we never got ours.   Cleanliness - yikes. This is where we had a problem. We sat at the corner table. There was a live roach flipped on its back with the legs still moving. Strike 1. Went to the ladies room to freshen up before our meal. There was another roach (see photo)!! Strike 2. Hence the 2 stars. Against our better judgement we still ate here!! We were staving. Don't judge me.   Service - we were basically served by one guy the whole time. I think his name is Angover. Yes, it sounds like hangover which is why we remembered the name.  He was very attentive n made sure to check on us even though we were dumped in a corner like a bad habit by the elder Korean lady (there were other tables available when we arrived). He also seemed to be the only one working hard.   Overall food was ok. Service was great. We're so spoiled by all the amazing ACYE back in LA.   Happy wasting ur money on mediocre KBBQ!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Roach #2

9frdv3MxNlTPWZk0fhEYZw.text: Came here for dinner after watching a movie with friends. Wanted to check it out since it was new and their icon is the maplestory pig XD (wonder who noticed?). Their prices are ok. $19.99 for AYCE dinner. $16.99 for AYCE lunch. Choice of 4 unmarinated items, 4 marinated items, then 6 more items available for dinner. Not much of a selection   As for side dishes, for us, we got 12 side dishes on top of a steamed egg, a soup, and a cheese corn... and the usual salad.. i was like oOo XD   So for the meats...  Plain - pork belly (usual thick cut pork belly), hwaro pork belly (same pork belly but thinner.. like 1/2 - 1/3 of the usual thickness, brisket (usual), and "tripe". Why i put quotation marks on tripe is because from the usual either honeycomb or the one with the layers, .... it was neither.. and was given a long piece of intestine.... wot? thats not even tripe D: no where on the menu says intestine so i guess mis-translation somewhere? Lol (super chewy btw)   Marinate - marinated sliced ribeye (bulgolgi), sweet & spicy pork, boneless marinated chicken, and pork skin. Pork skin was not what i expected. yeah its pork skin but im not too sure how to cook it. it softened up by cooking but it became gelatinous? i couldnt make it crispy cuz the grill made the skin carmelize XD   Dinner - baby octopus, short ribs (not that marinated, which is fine by me), pork shoulder butt, marinate pork ribs, spicy baby back ribs, beef sirloin of flank (what..? isnt sirloin and flank two different cuts/areas) with soy sauce.   The aformentioned green tea smoked pork belly and dessert menu is now covered and not available for AYCE.   not much of a fan of the place. service was a bit lacking on the ordering and water filling. they went to the korean tables like 3x before us once...starting to remind me of another pig restaurant... XD   its nice they renovated this place and made it live again from the old place but WHY YOU NO GIVE ME BEEF TONGUE :( i missed it during this meal.. .

mQTl6jXbOddP3T5yyAeB0Q.text: This is the best Korean BBQ in town. Hands down. Great food with a cool  atmosphere for a good price! The only downside is the parking! That parking lot gets crazy (like L.A. crazy). Just be aware and try to carpool!

9nPrcu9JHMN1hgC7WGc0Lg.text: Amazing food!!! 100% worth the money & wait!! Friendly staff, clean bathrooms and cheerful atmosphere!!

cdqrTH1iUKGaXn6iGaD3Fg.text: This place is my favorite spot for Korean BBQ. Recently I went to a competitor in Henderson and it was such a disappointment. I almost felt like I cheated on Hwaro.   The quality of the meats are great, flavorful, and they give you plenty. You are able to order half orders as well. The sides are a great selection and we love the bean sprouts!   The price is a great and reasonable price. I highly recommend this place. You can also call to be added to the seating list!

POWEuZFDgqMmjSGvzoa4JA.text: I went here last year with my bro and cousins during EDC weekend and it was my cousin who lived in Vegas introduced me to this place.The food and service were amazing. That's why we stop at hwaro again this year.

sQH8iEskQvmWdsTC622U2Q.text: We went here during our weekend in Vegas. We were looking for a place to eat before we do our foot massage and we found Hwaro.   When we came in, we were not seated immediately, seeing that there were available tables.  Once they sat us, I understood why they made us wait, the table was already prepared with all the side dishes and sauces (about 10 of them) plus a pint of water for each of us and that was a pleasant surprise.  Overall, there are 52 all you can eat choices in the menu for $20.95 which is a lot to select from for a very reasonable price.  The food was great tasting, the service was impeccable as we were very well attended, and they answered all our questions.   At the end of our meal I had to cancel our dinner reservation as we had so much food.  I will definitely come back to Hwaro when I return to Vegas.

0zIiEnW7OMdon1H_19UTNQ.text: Place has great side and plenty choices of meat! And the appetizers are the bomb dot com! Good to come in the afternoon, dinner gets cray busy

3hOKvxaA5GSm7d3aoymZTA.text: This place is awesome! Great fun environment! Sometimes the wait is long but so WORTH IT! It's great to go out with friends.

_9RqBVuxbkSqHGyeFB8s4g.text: I can't begin to explain what an amazing place is if you don't mind the wait or cramped seating it was truly delicious!

nD2W-U4WCsRJdEMqvsobLw.text: We eat at this place all the time and we are never disappointed! Definitely a place to try if you're vacationing here in Vegas!

KsJASIn9oeIQyLW8qBf53g.text: Great prompt service. Perfect food and meats . Recommend the sliced ribeye .the AYCE special is always worth it. The Shit (stuffed jalapenos is one of the best appetizers ive ever had great perfect spice and heat.

Cqvp5jdw4O9DoLkCLkgo9Q.text: One of the best! Order pork cheek. Its one of their unique meat you can't get anywhere else.

GVMujQ1VS4WR0BGq76yKWA.text: My go-to spot whenever I'm in Vegas. Great meat selection and I love the appetizers! Plus dessert!

lr6SRFbhXkzSM3ga-TCa1Q.text: Solid 4 stars! The lunch price of $16.99 was a deal considering the amount and quality of the food you get. We enjoyed the brisket, spicy pork ribs, pork belly and the ribeye. There was plenty of banchan to sample with the meats and the salad added a fresh accompaniment. Bonus points for the delicious bean curd soup and 'the shit' for the appetizers. Both were really flavorful and appetizing. The only thing I didn't like was the ice cream at the end of the meal which tasted artificial and wasn't creamy enough. BUT I don't go here for the ice cream, so can't complain!  The server also charged us the all day price of $19.99 instead of the $16.99 (we didn't order any of the all day meats). But they were quick to change it and apologetic when we pointed it out.  Awesome place to eat while in Vegas - just don't mind if you smell like KBBQ for the rest of the day!

R2QRfuh60RDMrOXbKYjcFg.text: I've been here a few times and I have to say - this is my favorite place in Vegas to get Korean BBQ! You can expect to wait for a long time, especially if you have a large party. Typically, on a Thursday or Friday night, our usual group of people who go wait about an hour and a half to get seated. There are so many options on the menu and it can be overwhelming. If you're coming for dinner, come with an empty stomach to get your money's worth for all you can eat. The customer service isn't great, but you can expect that, because the restaurant is always so busy. Love coming here!

Bj7DTYKMKeHlwvXLvn3y5Q.text: Bomb fire ass soju came here with my homies and drank some bomb ass soju if you tryna get lit come thru to this kbbq place.. it don't compare to no La but they give a free bottle of beer if you write this shit up

TMPJ64HrGfaxefeF-1td-w.text: Everything about this place is just awesome. Though same as all usual KBBQ in town expect the long wait. What i love the most here? you got bunch of selection regardless of what time.  in rating it 4 starts for improvements. Keep it up hwaro!

5n98fWYBne8vq7kq-Bh7BQ.text: The food is fantastic for a good price!! Bulgogi and the pork is the way to go hands down hwaro

j8Pn04KFOzzl6dJTxP4OZQ.text: Was there last night 3/17/18 with a party of 4.  There is a flat fee of $22.95 per person for all-you-can-eat, which you choose from a simple menu.  We paid $1.50 for each can soda and $10.50 for peach Soju.  You can order anything you want as many times as you like for 2 hours max, then they ask you to leave.  The best meat can only be ordered once per table, nonetheless, the portions are very generous, and the quality of the food is ok, but there are much better places in Las Vegas to have K-BBQ.  My 1 star rating is for the following reasons:    1.  Patrons who had just arrived, were allowed to skip the line and be seated ahead of others who like ourselves had been waiting for more than an hour; last time I checked, this is possible when you tip the guy controlling the waiting list....just saying.   2.  Our waitress was insufferable, when she felt we had been there long enough, not even an hour into our dining ,she came by our table every few minutes trying to turn-off our grille;  we clearly told her not to touch the controls but, in one occassion she succeeded, only to have to turn it back on because we still had plenty of meat grilling on the table.  She stood in front of our table looking at her wristwatch, like an angry mother waiting for her teenage kid to come home! Worst service ever! 3.  BE WARE:  15% TIP IS INCLUDED!  But no one tells you.  If you pay with a card, they will give you your transaction receipt, which does not show that the tip is included, on the contrary, it has the usual "tip" line.   Only when I asked and insisted in a detailed receipt is that I saw that the tip was included!!! 4.  Parking is very difficult to find, we had to park 1/2 a block away. 5.  The restaurant is extremely small, with practically no place to seat and wait, you must stand outside in the cold, like we did. 6.  Ventilation is none existent, and the smoke from the grilled meats will cling to you and your clothes, be prepared to leave the place smelling like a steak, so make this the last stop of your evening, unless you want every dog in the neighborhood to follow you home!

cwo--n_RBPAQjb00McIuxQ.text: Good place for ayce. Went here for a friends birthday. Excellent place to satisfy your kbbq cravings!

RXb6UXDx4bHxzozYj3IGcA.text: Moved to Vegas about a year ago, and have always had a thing for Korean BBQ. I recently discovered this place , and it not only exceeded my expectations, but it blew them off of this planet. I definitely recommend this place, and this place beats the place I always used to go to in San Diego. If I could give it 10 stars, I would.

kjBhbesvF38FtjOYnTSLWA.text: Always loved coming to this place, service has always been awesome, usually visit during a celebration. The bad review is primarily for the fact that our server told us we couldn't cut and eat the cake we brought for my cousins birthday. I'm not sure if their rules have changed, outside food is not allowed which is expected amongst almost all restaurants with the exceptions of cake for celebrations. The last time we visited was just a few months prior for another family members  birthday and our server even brought us out a lighter, extra plates, and a knife to cut her cake. Yesterday when we entered we brought a nothing but bundt cake and no one stated we couldn't have it until the very end when we asked if we could have extra plates for the birthday cake. Our server said no bc outside food was not allowed, we even told her we've been here before and that has never been a problem. Then she said we could blow out the candles but the cake must be consumed out of the restaurant. Other than this ordeal everything else was great food and all the other employees we came across during our visit. I guess just don't bother coming in for celebrations, I know we definitely won't anymore.

B9-B7X52wuijgMqkKHYpXQ.text: Went here on a date with my girlfriend, we were seated rather quickly given that there were so many people in line so that's a plus. Our server Jessica was amazing, she always checked on us and was always on top of our orders. My girlfriend barely goes to kbbq places so it was her second time to a kbbq restaurant and she loved it. I'd probably wouldn't recommend this place for a first date unless you guys are just there to eat and not talk because the music is LOUD . But it's the best place to be when out with a bunch of friends. I wish I had a picture of the food and our server Jessica so you can ask to be seated in her area. Great experience overall

0snvj8biiAs4TRRBGfaZxQ.text: I've come to Hwaro a good amount of times, and I have never been disappointed. Yes, wait can get a bit long during peak hours/days, but I'd say that's to be expected if you go during commonly busy times. I think Hwaro has a good amount of options of meats and appetizers/sides for the pricing, whether you get the late night/lunch or all day special. The meats are good quality, and I feel like overall quality is pretty consistent. The servers are usually pretty attentive and accommodating when it comes to things like grill changes/adjustments and ordering more. They've also been very helpful in answering questions, and allowing smaller or half orders of meats we wanted to try for the first time. I usually order spicy pork bulgogi, regular bulgogi, short ribs, brisket, The Shit, and cheese corn. Then from there I decide where I want to switch things up. The bulgogi meats are my favorites since they're usually really tender and flavorful. Just be mindful with the spicy pork bulgogi, as the marinade can make the grill char/smoke more quickly.  Although I haven't made it through the whole menu yet, I'm definitely getting there. Definitely one of my go-to/favorite all you can eat KBBQ places in Vegas!

dzy-lHAOR3kgIw6NRaFWWg.text: Hwaro was a typical korean bbq, the quality of the meet was really nice and the taste was good. However their menu is a little small and i think they should open it up a bit. They just remodeled so it was very cute inside and the music was good. Towards the end of my meal i felt a little rushed, she took our dessert order and brought it out before we were even done eating. and the desert is usually really good except this time the ice cream was icy.

H9K1yvnXW1nl4PnBe3dDmA.text: Completely don't understand why this restaurant earns 4 star. We ordered the late night $19.9 all u can eat as we came at 11:30pm. This price doesn't include four special meat. It is cheap but not worth. We are really disappointed. This Korean BBQ is not authentic at all and is bad. Too much oil on both meat and grill. Found egg shell more than once in the steamed egg. Side dishes taste weird as well. Will never ever come back again. 2 stars for being open till 3 am I guess?

exlrWa8CCL7VdsLpvOVkWw.text: I came here twice with friends in the span of one week after hearing so many people rave on and on about this particular KBBQ place and while there are a lot of options and the meat is good quality, I wasn't blown away or impressed.   The service we got on both days was mediocre at best. I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt the first time. Maybe they were just really busy and not accustomed to handling a busy floor? Second time around was the same thing. We had to flag down multiple servers to be noticed. The second time was actually worse than the first time. I'm not sure if it was because they knew we were a larger party and we would automatically be charged gratuity? Not sure.   The first time I came they didn't have the gyoza and green mussels, but was not too hung up over that--they ran out of stuff sometimes right? Second time I came, they had both, but only the guoza ever came. I asked a couple times for mussels, but just gave up because it never came.   I am only giving it 3 stars because they had some unique options that other Kbbq places didn't have such as their Spicy Jalapeno Beef Belly--my personal favorite. They also had a seafood salad (which was something I only expected at a sushi restaurant), as well as bulgogi nachos.   I wish I could love it as much as all the others that rave on about it, but it's definitely a lot more expensive than kbbq places like GEN that cost less and have just as many options, but with better service. Not sure if I'll return.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Affogato Ice Cream
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Our table

vfP3GMBQt2oDssSe4cH2Bw.text: Hands down, best KBBQ place in Las Vegas.   PROS Hwaro has side dishes, appepitzers, and quality meat. For the side dishes, I appreciate how they offer more than your basic kimchi and fish cake; my favorites are the rice paper, pa muchim (scallion salad), and picked radish. For appetizers, they have interesting stuff like cheese fondue to dip your various meats in, bulgogi nachos, bean paste soup, steamed egg, and shake shake rice. Most importantly, they serve quality (I repeat QUALITY) meat for an AYCE place. I recommend the beef tongue (don't hate it until you try it), short ribs, brisket, red wine pork belly, and enoki beef. Also, they give you green tea ice cream or affogato style vanilla ice cream for dessert.   CONS The service is hit or miss. They are always busy and the servers are usually quick, refill your water before it's empty, all that other good stuff, but there have been times where I question if my server have forgotten about our table.   OVERALL You can't be mad about delicious, AYCE, family style kbbq with cute korean decor/atmosphere. I come here at least once a month, and more when I have an excuse to celebrate something lol.

fJA5UFFjK43lIPYEOxEBKg.text: This place has become me and my bf's new spot. I have to say the service is amazing. beWeARAxkJZdoD92t6A2WA.text: We arrived and had our group listed because there was a waiting line. They were really busy. I wondered why then when we were seated and made our orders for the lunch special at $19.95 per head (all you can eat) and our orders arrived (we ordered only the different cuts of beef), I already found out why. They had a lot of appetizers and you can always ask for a refill. I like the fish cake the best, it is my favorite plus the radish and kimchi! We also have a very accommodating and nice server I forgot her name but she was pleasant. There was also one server who had assisted us her name is Janice. She was equally pleasant and nice.  Aside from the good quality of food they serve, customer service made me give them 4 stars. Could have been 5 stars if the dessert is unlimited or they have additional dessert choices but that is just my opinion. It was a great korean bbq experience at Hwaro. No wonder why people keep coming there. I guess they will be busy from opening till closing. Good food plus good customer service.   I will definitely be back with our visiting relatives and friends. They will surely enjoy it too!

This is my go to Korean bbq if I'm with a group of friends who just wants to have fun while eating and drinking sake! And that's because of the friendly vibe of the place   We enjoyed their appetizers especially their Oh Shit stuff and their Hwaro Rice is truly a must try item. Love their Affogato dessert as well.   Affordable, nothing fancy and very casual ambiance. You'll leave with a happy tummy!

r80XMzmkbdywu54KaGCNFQ.text: I highly recommend Hwaro. You really get a lot of food!!! I'm greedy, so I was extremely happy. One of the things I enjoyed most was cooking the meat on the grill at the table. It was a lot of fun, especially with a group of friends.   I also enjoyed all of MANY side dishes that are served with dinner. They were delicious :)  Don't forget to order ice cream and padak! OMG!!! It was soooooo good. I think I ordered three of them and ate every bit of it.   The prices are also very reasonable for all of the food they serve. Great service!!

f8AGY7gGMv78NCgq-95azw.text: Great food with a decent price.  Been here plenty of time a it, but not sure why I haven't wrote a review.  Guess better late then never.    I like the electronic check in, but like everywhere else, you can't check in until you get here.  Then the entire party needs to be here before you are seated.  Skirt steak is always a winner. We ordered four to start and it came with two strips.  Then I asked for two more order and two more strips came out.  Egh?...  Brisket is my go to and I started with four orders and they brought a plate full.  I asked for two order later and they brought the same amount as before. I'm starting to think it's always a plate regardless.  I just never noticed until yesterday.  Garlic butter melts in about 10 minutes and is a great dipping sauce for any meat.    Hwaro spicy rib steak had a nice marinade.  Not sure what's in it, but it had a sweet and spicy taste.  KFC - is a good starter if you like bite size fried chicken.  Pork belly, more please!  What I learned, order two plates of brisket to start if you like brisket, then order everything else by the strip or pieces to avoid misunderstanding.    So get out their and eat up!

5loZqYq3qacaZseMWzoasQ.text: First time here! I am not disappointed, our server Rino and all the staff were super nice and sweet! Food was amaaaaaaaaaaaaaazing!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

oIm70Nkj7Qzef8jw4_FUIg.text: Tyler the manager is the reason this busy place stays afloat. Excellent service from ALL the staff and to top it all off? The food is H.O.E. AF.   HEAVEN  ON EARTH

CxYF6cTE-xPR7mP5IN8YMg.text: Very busy! But we were able to be seated 20 min. for a party of 9! We had the all you can eat! For $20!! Service was excellent. Food very delicious. Meat was given in very generous portions. Grills were changed pretty frequently so our meat wouldn't burn.. Definitely will be back in the future.

sMY13Dqccg7pxc8Drg4wbg.text: This kbbq has a lot of choices for what you want. The bonchons were mediocre. The meat was actually pretty good. The Star was actually for how decent the meat was.  If you come here expect long wait times than what they mention. We waited an extra 45 minutes on top of the hour we were already told. Lastly expect to cook the meat yourself. Besides the beginning with our server (Jehsica) helping us cook, she was nowhere to be found otherwise you would have burnt meat on your grill.  Also be aware they have a one hour 20 minute time limit that they actually time you to the second.

z_E9z8V-vekWqo9ICBSGxg.text: The place wasn't even that busy but i had to get up to get the attention of the server.  Did this 3 times, never even checked up on the corner table.  Warning dont ever get seated in the corner table.  The meat was tough and the quality was so so.  Another i dont like is i am forced to pay a service fee for crappy service...  too bad i cant give a half star

iYRQ41OV188alSp1yqAIQw.text: Finally tried this place out after a couple of Yelpers had recommended this place.  I came with my mom, auntie and uncle and we arrived around 12:15pm on a weekday.  The place was packed already!  We had to wait about 25 minutes for a table.  My family is use to going to Sura BBQ and that place is pretty big so they weren't use to the smaller environment.   Omgoodness my mom really is getting old bcs she complained about everything at Hwaro.  She complained that the noise level was too much (they were playing kpop), the tofu soup was too salty, the rice undercooked, them having no knives (although I saw the server give a knife to another table...??), the heating element wasn't strong enough... I don't think I'm gonna take my mom anywhere anymore.   For me, I enjoyed my meal minus having to listen to my mom whine.  I liked how they had ice water bottles at the table for you to pour your own water.  They also leave the sauce container for the table.  Those little things make a difference bcs I don't have to wait for a server to obtain those items.    We ordered the all day special bcs I wanted to try the enoki beef and my mom wanted the premium steak.  I also wanted beef tongue.  We ordered a bunch of red meats, red wine pork belly along with the squid and baby octopus.  Also the kfc, seafood salad, bean sprouts, steamed egg, cheese corn, garlic butter and the tofu soup.    The seafood salad was very good, light fresh and 1 of the many limited seafood items they have here.  The KFC was fantastic!  It was juicy, tender and quite tasty.  Bean sprout salad had more green onions than sprouts, steamed egg was good - would have liked more to share for a table of 4 ppl (only 1 order allowed per table), tofu soup as my mom said, was too salty.  The fish cake was good, radish could use more vinegar, potato salad was surprisedly really good but also really filling.  All the meats were good, but the winner of it all was the squid!  It is marinated beautifully and we couldn't stop eating it!   We sat at one of the middle tables so the wooden bench got uncomfortable after 30 mins.  The decor of the cherry blossom tree by the front of the restaurant brings life and a bit of cheeriness to the dark wooden themed restaurant.    My mom was also disappointed that there wasn't more desserts available like pumpkin soup, red bean soup... bcs Sura has that... I thought the affogato hit the spot. It did take them 10 mins to get it out to us but then again it seemed like the whole restaurant was waiting on dessert.    My mom doesn't want to come back bcs she thinks Hwaro is "too hip" and trendy - she said "its for the young ppl"... I liked it.  I'll be back minus my mom, that's for sure.  Can't take her nowhere :/   They also added 15% gratuity bcs we were a party of 4, which made it easy when we were paying the bill, no need to bust out the calculator.  Ohh and PULL HARD for the front door, that thing is heavy!

XkX-vxnVOckiTvgGcPDImQ.text: Place is decent. Service was good. Only complaints is that they don't have a premium steak on the menu, meat is very frozen and we got cut off early even though we weren't ordering a lot. Might come back might not.

gW0U9jC85FzQ_mqRniv05g.text: Jessica was a fantastic server! First time at this Korean BBQ restaurant.  Everything was as expected with excellence service.

fNg7YrVMkJYMwT9BR1e93w.text: They put modern twists on Korean dishes, but the food was just okay to me in comparison to other truly authentic Korean restaurants. I've grown up eating Korean, so maybe I'm picky. Good rule of thumb I use, if you see a lot of Korean customers eating, then the Korean restaurant is good. This place was full and there wasn't a single Korean customer. Nice ambiance though.

pbnSm6fNZN78Joob7xttew.text: Definitely a top spot in LV for KBBQ. I enjoy tripe, which I know many people do not, but I do not like it here. It is too thick and chewy. So instead I get their special appetizer on the AYCE menu... the Sh*t. And I get a ton of meat.   There is normally a wait at night, but understandable. When you sit for KBBQ, you're not just in and out! Which reminds me, gotta go write another review for a burger joint!

pbK4AZz6VyxtHs3t0Qq-Ng.text: This place is a good deal, $20 per person during lunch. We ordered a bunch of things: brisket, beef bulgogi, chicken bulgogi, the Shit (deep fried roll), steamed egg, and rice paper. We had garlic butter and cheese with corn as dips - I prefer the cheese over the butter.  Service was good as our waitress was pleasant and knowledgeable. The wait was about 20 min. The service could have been a bit quicker because I had to leave for my flight and we waited 10 minutes for our dessert but had to leave before getting any. Would recommend this place for the food to others!

e8_qk0xu0s4FCwljzCR8xA.text: This was a fun Korean BBQ place. Loved the staff and the atmosphere. So many side dishes and meats to choose from. Will def come back.  The all you can eat price is very resonable.

qnWdR1ITTA-InCeiO_nMtw.text: Visited this AYCE Korean BBQ for lunch with a group of 6 during our time in Las Vegas. It was maybe at most a 20 minute drive from the strip, but it seemed like a pretty popular spot since there was still a bit of a wait near the end of lunch time (around 3pm).  We didn't wait terribly long, roughly 20 minutes, and they take names and call you when your table is ready. Luckily for us, it's also located in the same complex next to a Kung Fu Tea, where undoubtedly many others go to grab bubble tea beforehand while waiting to gorge themselves on meat. Maybe it was just us.  The variety of options was great for the price with ice cream included at the end too! They have nice options for side dishes to go with your meat that includes steamed egg amongst the typical ban chan like kimchi, radish kimchi, and cucumber.  Service was attentive and we were able to enjoy our meal and head out in a decent amount of time. My group of friends and I are from NYC where AYCE Korean barbeque places are few and far between with extravagant pricing (as much as you'd end up paying for Bacchanal Buffer) so this was a steal for us.

SlCOuJlRGd1X-Tklpsi1sg.text: One of our favorite Korean bbq places. We've been here a few times and our last visit was during Mother's Day. (Wife LOVES Korean bbq).  Place is always pretty busy so plan to wait a little. On such a busy day we only waited about 20 minutes which isn't bad at all for Mother's Day!  We always get one of the combo meals and we order spicy cold noodles (wife's favorite dish) and a soft tofu soup (one of my favorite soup). The combo with the extras is enough for our family of 3, us two and 7yr old son. When we have our daughter with us we usually have to order a bit more because the amount of meat is on the smaller side. They do serve soup, egg, salad and other sides with the combo  dinner but the portions of the meats are not that much. I'd say about 3-4 oz of meat per selection prior to cooking.  The staff has always been super attentive and actually handle the bbq for you!  To some it might be burdensome having a server at your table reaching over attending the meat on the grill but to us it's just part of the experience. They will let you handle the bbq yourself if you wish so that's not an issue.  The combo also comes with some veggies to roast and a cool icecream dessert.   For Mother's Day, wifey got a ride and a coupon for our next visit.   4 stars only due to the amount of meat served with each combo. It can be slightly bigger for the price point. Yes it's good quality meat and good cuts of meat but 1-2 more ounces won't hurt.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Beef combo. Brisket portion.

NgS_LpG1eNNa9JlBrDj2kw.text: Come early. Food is great. Great atmosphere and family-friendly. Authentic Korean food makes a really popular spot

n6fScXobRLPnMefyPqxW7g.text: Thank you lord!! My prayers were heard. I'm so glad that I don't have to settle for Tofu Hut anymore. Vegas has the best ayce sushi but I found myself missing O.C. for the ayce kbbq T_T now I don't have to "visit family" to have delicous kbbq.  I can never fully cheat on Mr. Bbq in Fullerton, hence Hwaro gets 4 stars but its also because I think service could be better and pricing is a little high. Besides that, the meat quality is great and the banchan is yummy. Something else I like is that they have dipping sauce other than just salt and oil.  Cute decor too!

9THxNPq15SWlv6qOKSt-Rw.text: Best Korean bbq I've ever had. There's lot of selection. We ordered the steak and it was so good especially when you dip it with their cheese fondue. I like their salad, kimchi and their fish cake. I pretty much like everything in here. You'll get what you actually paid for. We always recommend this place with our friends and family that doesn't leave here in vegas.

7kRcs3ypWeI6gwlJGzDvKQ.text: When you take food quality, cleanliness, and price into consideration, I consider Hwaro as the best AYCE Korean BBQ restaurant in Vegas. Since they first opened, I visited this place quite a few times and always walked out feeling happy and satisfied (and super heavy from all the food I ate.. LOL) In the past, I would visited Sura but it seemed that while their price kept going up ($28 the last time I visited), Sura's food quality and cleanliness went downhill. Unless things change in the future, this is the place I will go for KBBQ craving.

VkSqFxXP4WNxW8vulPvLuQ.text: The worst customer service! From the time we sat the table, not even one server acknowledge us. We had to ask the busser to send one our way. After all the waiting, food made it on our table and when the server was asked for more food she disgustingly said she will be right back as shes busy. Even soda took long to be brought in our table. Decided to order more food, the food was never delivered to us. At that point could not help myself but say something, i told the server how poor their service is. She came back with the check and proudly addressed "as a courtesy i took this off your check" guess... A $1.50 soda was taken out of the check! -- first of all when i tell someone how bad your service is, that doesn't mean i am out to get anything for free! I take my family out to enjoy our meal and not to get something for free! Take guests comments to improve your service! This is our first and last time in this place. Consider how filthy this place is, i will remember to send the health inspector your way for random check after shes done signing Grade A for my place.

XmMoM0D9MWFKNIaqIInelg.text: First time at a Korean BBQ.  Very varied menu, good service, and quite an experience.  However, it would have been nice if the waitress explained the process when I asked instead of just nodding her head.

gcoX0RdDoIeomkdSPB6qAA.text: Came on a thursday night around 8pm with a group of 10 people. They were able to accomodate us without no problem and our server Jennifer is funny and helpful! Been here a couple times now and still never had a bad service!

YiHcYfGgKVOPBEf71LOSJg.text: Great place to eat for lunch...a little bit pricey but definitely worth it! Especially the Shit! Busy but worth the wait!

7V32ecBcPJo6ZfvfeBL6kg.text: This is my favorite Korean BBQ place! The price is reasonable and I love going during their late night special! The spicy bulgogi is my absolute favorite! The place is always clean and I always enjoy my time here!

SQN2rtrMkxUqcHhQzuT-UA.text: Mmmm...this is the best Korean BBQ ever in Las Vegas. You should try it if you are interest in BBQ.

lPohpinmkuT6zLCCpi6FGA.text: Delicious food and good price. And very Gogol service

oGGrHSTwWmMTZEID_NPiBA.text: Great place to eat on vacation. Great value $20/$23 for Korean BBQ buffet. Can't beat that price. Good selection and service! Opens late til 3am. Definitely a place to try..

vBPKd7Ir3m1hZ7OoCx4Xzg.text: I had my doubts about this place when I found out it was a buffet.  Boy was I pleasantly surprised...the food was good and you can order as much as you want!  Everything was good including the tofu soup. I would gladly go back to this place again.

dx7O2XzcU-tKUkIqC68j7g.text: I love their Korean barbeque!!! Happy hour starts at 10 and honestly it's the only all you can eat barbecue place I go to in the Las Vegas valley

-Fwr_rfOdX4aTAaWfUkbKg.text: This place was a huge disappointment from the food to the service I don't know the high yelp reviews on this one.

86nDYqFu0G3T5qFPnDoxzw.text: This place is veey good. Love the guest service here. Foid is too of the line and everyone is very helpfuland friendly. 5 stars all the way around.

ePO_mGAozamdIa76gBCLJg.text: My wife and I came here with some of our family friends. All you can eat for dinner is around $20 per head. Lunch is around $17 per head which is ok. The food was good. The beef and chicken bulgogi tasted good and the side dishes were ok. They don't have though those spicy mochi rice cakes i love. Service and ambience were also good. Overall, its a pretty good place to eat but there are other places closer to where we live that have the same food.

AJIOVZpCZaxiZkESBBvw7w.text: I've gone to this place 3 times and each time, the food and service were great; there was also little wait each time I went. Of all the korean bbqs in the area, Hwaro is my first choice. Their Korean bbq meat is very delicious, I especially enjoyed their brisket and beef flank. The service was impeccable as our server, Jayden, was very mindful of our needs such as when we wanted to order more food, needed drink refills and when we needed the grill changed. My only complaint is that their wooden floors can get rather greasy and slippery. It is not a big deal but just something I noticed when I eat there. Other than that, I will be getting my kbbq fixes here and wholeheartedly recommend this place for anyone who is looking to enjoy delicious food under friendly staff.

B3VAXi95DfKR4irofuDweg.text: Maybe it's because I have been spoiled with LA's KBBQ but this place was not that great to me. All the marinated meat tasted exactly the same. They did not have rice paper or lettuce to wrap your meat with. Service was slow and the guy who was our server forgot some of the meat we ordered. I don't think I will be back.

vWYJQJDf5YhGS0Yf2YsMDw.text: Awesome! Great selection and fun atmosphere.  I come here all the time.  Keep up the good work!

7z-wjYazBqXxsURuOrRWIw.text: This is my favorite korean bbq in town i just wish they would expand their place or move to much bigger one...i dont like the 40 mins to 1 hr wait(if not more) thats why me and my family dont go often...

TniQeC2HtrhNAdYTXvL6JA.text: Wonderful quaint hole in the wall, much larger than expected, vibes here are pristine

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Dining area

1W61edLf_bUpcHXzoZkCQA.text: The service was good and the price is cheaper than most other Korean BBQ places. There is also a late night special where it is even cheaper.   There is a good variety of food for what you pay for and it was delicious.

6MnYF5YV_Wge4f6ZP19f5Q.text: 17.95 lunch and late night worth!!! Bulgogi nachos are lit!rice, lit, salad lit, water lit

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

JvzuVbm5g_TVo80HtJ4LRQ.text: HwAro continues to impress with its excellent variety and quality of meats and appetizers.  My favorite dish is the premium hwarro steak and the manager Jun and server Hannah are awesome

lLEmeEDSJ1hKT8s2WxZPKw.text: Service was extremely quick and food was good. Only issue was their rice paper was very dry.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

Q_tEk6Jf1ySyFxmypEVZZA.text: Love this joint.   $20 for all you can eat. ***Do not over order; they will charge for excess ordering.***  Tip: Be ready to order fast. They all seem to be in a rush here. That seems to be the general attitude in a lot of the restaurants in China Town.   We ordered:  Marinated Sliced Ribeye Sweet & Spicy Pork  Pork Belly Enoki Beef Act Like Korean  First off, there was just two of us. It was WAY too much food. We ate the majority of it, but we were INSANELY full. I had to unbutton AND unzip my pants. But, this was all good meat. It's not like this crazy high quality of meat, but it's well worth the $20 you spend.   Best part - it is super fun to cook your own meat to get it to your liking. This is a perfect place for a date night if you're both looking for something new and fun. WARNING: you will smell like you've been grilling meat all night. And you WILL smell of garlic. Some people dig it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Pork Belly - delicious.

-1aOqM9YiP0fYnx3IPKbyg.text: This place was a stumble upon find. LATE NIGHT looking for some Korean BBQ. Hwari was the right place to come. Inside cubical decorations are very cool. Its like you are somplace else.  Nari our server was very attentive and helped us we all the questions we had. The cow tongue and enoki beef is my two favorite. The baby octopus is a must!! Most memorable piece of the dinner. Worth every penny. Would reccommend to my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Soup for the cold.
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. The first piece..

nn7i80k0xd1Vu-N_8fs_eg.text: I can't remember how many times I have been here. But every time I always gave them 5 stars. They never make me disappointed if there food or even there services.  I just found that Garlic Jalapeno Pork Bally, Signature Pork Cheek and Bf Frank were awesome.

m_Hfw5zM7wP8xQABmIw1Qg.text: I must admit, I love this place.  **The bulgogi is the only thing that's important to life.  **I have to subtract a star, because their steamed egg is not the best I've had.  **The portion size for my table of 4 took time to getting adjusted to.  **Didn't like the lack of space I was provided for my table as plates were piling up from small portions.  Recommendations: Portion control (more food on plate for bigger group), work on the steamed egg, keep up the great work on the product you offer.

inNrF4oq1QhdND45HiJDGw.text: Great environment, delicious korean marinated beef, friendly employees...  second time here, I will definitely come again!

LCfkSJyCwnyp7pITJhdUiQ.text: Everything was perfect except for the long wait. But then most good restaurants are like that. Service was amazing, food was tasty, 5 stars!!!

CEdKh-CYj1rnEKM1cEV62A.text: I frequent this place, and for AYCE this place has the best bang for your buck. I've eaten at tofu hut and sula and hwaro definitely has the largest selection available for you. The service can be a little bit slow but who isn't when they're packed at prime time.   Give this place a shot, you won't regret it!  Update: they've changed the menu a little bit but it's absolutely spectacular. I would absolutely still recommend this place.

v46OEFKYIrWvK5Q0pSB9Zg.text: It was really cold probably because it was raining but the food is good. Would be nice if they had more seating for people waiting. It was a little crowded by the door.  The best meat on the menu is the sliced rib eye, avoid appetizers just go straight to the BBQ.

XPPrKDbnu7gr6xrQRWR2Ug.text: Definitely a must try and great environment!!! Food looks delicious!!!! Food smells great from.the.outside... its a lil bit of a wait on a tuesday but its coz its sooo good... come with an empty stomach and relatively well priced...  this will be my go to korean bbq spot!!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

rd2g48wzF0Y0mk40mTEUGg.text: This is the best all you can eat Korean BBQ in Vegas. We had a big party(14). Took about 45 mins to get seated, very busy place. I noticed if you go with 4 or less people you get seated a little faster. If you go with a big party I recommend going before 6pm if possible.  Before you get seated  water and the side kimchi are already on the table with the bomb salad. Few things we ordered and were really good.   Bulgogi, kalbi, pork belly, gyoza, brisket, rice paper, steamed egg and the best  meat of the night. prime steak!!! For desert we had this ice cream coffee thing (BOMB)!!!! The service was awesome. Multiple people that worked here came to our table and asked if we are ok. I felt really appreciated. They changed the grill multiple times, I think changing the grill is a must so you can taste all the different meats they have... oh and the food was amazing!!!! This is my new best ayce Korean BBQ.

MWRqOWcbafmrqqcIJslYVw.text: My cousin and his gf brought me and my bf here to show us that it was better than tofu hut and wow! We're from LA and I believe this is the best kbbq place I've been too. My boyfriend ranked it number 2 after a kbbq literally in Korea so that was a big one! The Shit is reallly the shit!! I also love all the sides and variety of meats!

fkN3GafXJCEd-p3W--IINw.text: This is definitely my favorite AYCE Korean BBQ restaurant! I prefer this to Gen or Tofu Hut. I recommend the red wine and green tea pork belly, brisket, bulgogi, squid, baby octopus, sliced ribeye, skirt steak, green mussels, and spicy pineapple steak! "The Shit" appetizer is great too, it's similar to an appetizer by the same name I've had at sushi restaurants like Sakana. The affogato dessert (sweet coffee and ice cream) is amazing too! That's the first time I've had it with corn flakes and it seemed strange at first but it added a nice crunch. There's still quite a few items on the menu I've yet to try but I'd like to during my next visit.

rKLQKZAEgOC4FEXnEEdj1Q.text: Wake up kids, we've got the dreamers disease...  AYCE for $20...how can you go wrong? Well, if you were expecting amazing or even good cuts of meat at this price you were in fact dreaming with me.  Hwaro is the place to go if you're looking to fill up on Korean BBQ, are on a budget, and love to smell like you just hung out at a Korean campfire for the rest of the night. I'm really not going to hate on Hwaro that much. As is often the case, you seriously get exactly what you pay for here...maybe even a little more. You're paying for a bunch of cheap cuts of meat and tasty sauces, resulting in what some will appreciate, but what I find a waste.   I am certainly biased. I try to limit my intake of meat products and seldomly splurge on AYCE. But even if I'm eating meat, I find it far more enjoyable to spend more on better quality.   If you do come here give yourself extra time to park in this cash cow food plaza, or come off peak hours, which may be a good idea anyway--the staff was very friendly, but had a difficult time keeping up with the tables. The banchan sides were ample, but nothing special.  ...and in the end, the love you take Is equal to the love you make

3h6SvpbpKgau2LBQqvfF8w.text: Very fast service! High quality meats! A lot to choose.  It comes with dessert too! Note that they will not accomodate party of 1.

5FIbFdefqy--0zGsQqjW6Q.text: This place is very good ! Very great environment and the service was great. The food was A1 as can be and the meat was just on point. I would deff  come back again!

MZvElHHoExgGM1DsXdlXqQ.text: I actually didn't eat here but to offer a little advice. I went there alone and  after waiting on a list was told they cant serve just one person. so if you are going alone dont expect service. was referred to this place as being good though.

7cuOJgjh-EFoZqYsAvtfKA.text: Pretty fast and friendly service. They are pretty quick to change out your grill and take your order. I love the kalbi! Much better than tofu hut. 19.99 for ayce dinner.

3virXaQkACpfmS_fn0vs6w.text: The customer service here was exceptional! All the recommendations (from Jitto) exceeded expectations. The grill was was changed on a regular basis and he regularly asked if we needed anything else. The food was on point and cannot wait to come back again!

XYskqYLRMyNpsRTBb7MBxA.text: FYI. No rice paper  sauces are good, steam egg but tofu soup is plain. -1 star for no rice paper

JplCD6ytgdMKJFDp7llfQQ.text: They have corn cheese. They play kpop. The service is great. Lots of items to pick from and small portions so you can try lots of items. Usually long wait times though, even on week nights. How on earth do people write such long reviews on here that pretty much sums up all I wanted to say you already know Korean BBQ never disappoints.

kvPOCnvjS7KKESLPkHF4pw.text: This place is my new favorite KBBQ spot. Meat is good as well as the sides. Service can be a little bit of a hit and miss, but usually it's pretty good. There are certain servers here that are absolutely fantastic while the others are not as attentive, so to say.

NmPUqDDDQMgMMZ0MvSQxSw.text: I've been to several Korean BBQ's in Vegas and many are greasy and dirty. But this one was immaculately clean and the food was delish. Of course, it depends on what you order and how you cook your meats. If you are craving a ton of protein, this is the place to load up. My favorite is the flank steak and I loved all the small side dishes to accent the flavors. I ate and ate until I was about to burst. Definitely go for the lunch buffet, its a bargain. I love this style of dining which gives us plenty of time to spend with friends and family over conversation while cooking the food to desire and immediately consuming it fresh and hot.

hyDzU002tjVAAU5IPr9o_Q.text: hwaro is such a cute place! i love the ambiance it presents as well as the service they provide. the food is good quality and their menu grants a nice quantity of choices for all.

86lQ9fgS5qfWCS3Rbkfi_w.text: Always come down here! The service is great the meat is great if you love Korean bbq then you'll love Hawro!

Sg-X4p6empQUlBJKZLbXWw.text: Food was great service was great! The only downside is they serve canned soda instead of fountain soda and they don't have bottled water. We will definitely be back to eat there again!

TyCJZM2EZDM40fIL1aLKoA.text: There was a cockroach in the salad they served. I should have taken a picture of it. It was nasty. The server showed it to one other server and he dropped it. Stay far, far away from this place.

EBCgvc-AoQJ3hyWHc_PZwA.text: This place is SOOOOOO GOOD.   It was my first time eating this type of food and when I tell you I can't WAIT to go back.   It's very cost friendly and the staff is amazing.   Our waitress Harland was the sweetest person ever.  She was very friendly and helped me with food suggestions.   Def hands down a 5 out of 5

E0OEjlppTYpa0BD_O43KpQ.text: My favorite Korean BBQ. Great options and delicious side dishes! Every time have. We are here food is always fresh because they are always have customers.

iX1nGj6pvhRZfG1gG1zGpA.text: Good meats, good service.  Some items took a little longer to bring out.  The meats are thick if you like that.

r5AFHIbua_9dOa5MXeWsEg.text: I'm so glad to find this ayce Korean BBQ! First of all, everything is delicious and all the servers would always come by your table to check if you need anything, now that's real customer service!. I recommend this place if you're in Vegas and craving for good Korean food. They're even open late, I will keep coming back here for sure.

kmPGwb9vsrtkNpvq1Dk5MA.text: The spicy bulgogi and whatever. It was alright. Nothing memorable. The service needs to be improved. We had to ask for things twice.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

H-P2jbtl9btGaJ4kI_oQXw.text: Being from Hawaii, I am so used to having access to yakiniku restaurants at all times of the day. So being that I have not had yakiniku for several months I was starting to get desperate to find one ASAP.Went on Yelp! and found this place was near by so I decided to give it a try. Overall a good experience. Food was good and the banchan was good as well. Customer service could have been better (our waters were never filled, never came to check on us unless we waved him down, etc.) Would this be the first place I'd recommend to people? not necessarily. BUT if you're just looking to find somewhere to "get the job done" then this place will do that.

g8xvAxt2qY5tArp5aIHGpg.text: We tried to go to Tofu Hut first, but did not want to wait that long to eat, so we decided to try Hwaro instead.  I came here on a Saturday night around 11pm and only had to wait about 15 minutes for a table.  We chose the AYCE option for $16.99 - what a great deal!  They had a variety of choices to choose from, we tried the normal beef brisket, pork belly, spicy pork belly, a few of the marinated meats.  The service was pretty good.  We also ordered the tofu soup, which if I could redo that... I would stick with the meat instead.  You can still order the bean paste soup and steamed egg that comes with it, so it was pretty good deal! I'll probably be back here next time I'm in Vegas craving some Korean bbq.

P0OalY0UcKPsYUbn9lITpQ.text: The best kbbq I've had so far. It has a lot of selection including unlimited appetizers. Their bean paste soup is amazing and an appetizer called "The Shit" is a must. The meat had better quality than most other kbbq places and it is only $19.99

Q8CtFO7xztnTlrUadvYp-w.text: Tofu Hut, move aside!  We LOVE this place. The prices are right, the amount of food and the quality of it is amazing.   Food: AWESOME. About $20 a pop for all you can eat. Everything we tried was very good, especially the wine marinated pork belly. They give you a lot of sides as well, and their spicy salad is very comparable to other KBBQ's in the area.  Service: Now this stands out. You will always have someone coming by every few minutes to check on you and make sure you are having a good time. You don't get this at most places, all you get is just a blank nod and the check when you aren't even halfway done.   Parking kind of sucks, especially on peak times, but that's to be expected. Be prepared for dropped suspension neon 1995 Honda's with mufflers the size of a bowling balls roaring here and there though. ;)

f52Gn98QeDkZzy0D8nkkvw.text: Waiting 45mins to only be skipped because we were waiting outside and none of the employees had the common sense to check with the people waiting directly in front of their establishment.  We forgave them and decided to wait inside for another 10mins for them to give our table to another skipped party who left and missed their turn, but decided to come back..!  All the employees look miserable and give a very negative vibe. I'm used to bad service from Korean establishments, but this was just pure negligence!

F0KrzK5DVGEw-gi67ocJrQ.text: Best AYCE kbbq in town. If your here in Vegas u must it. It might be a long wait for dinner time but it's totally worth it. Must come hungry to be able to try everything. Try there premium steak, mussle, seafood salad (if you like sashimi), "the shit", cheese corn, potato salad. They offer good customer service as well and  all of their servers are very attentive and friendly. Also you get a scoop of ice cream for dessert.

dRAGSBn2jrEmpqdvEKjDMw.text: Good atmosphere. Clean. Try the skirt steak. Also, you get a free drink if you show them your review on yelpy

4Kup6Fakt0qkW8JOGCV_hQ.text: This place is really good it's literally "the shit", the shit is a must try, strongly recommended this place.

5IBNsAeMmwV6wDtK8DerZg.text: Good food. Great and very very fast services. They always ask you if you need anything to eat more. Try the ice cream to change the taste then continue  with the meats.

lhH6O8I_Nf11z91lsDjURQ.text: The meat are well flavored and the seadfood salad is so good! I would really recommend this place. Probably the best korean bbq i've tried here!

MdIEtUmlF-x870MH8O_OXg.text: Went there today looking forward to another good Korean BBQ dinner with the husband.  Walked in around 4:45pm, put our name down and sat there waiting with another couple who was there before us. Restaurant was not busy at all and there was a few empty table. Waited and waited, saw a few worker came back and forth behind the counter and no one acknowledge us.  Waited again for another few minutes and still no one greeted us or letting us know how long it's going to be. We waited a few more minutes finally a guy with a black shirt picked up the clip board and looked at it, walked away and said to another co-worker "there's 4 people, I don't know what to do?" I was shocked from what he said. At this point still no greeting or acknowledgement.  My husband and I finally decided to get up and leave.  We have no problem waiting especially during shift change and everything but not even a greeting or acknowledging your guests that's a big no no.

uyTwuMqA3XpPDNvSbIFHFg.text: I used to eat here before and I used to be happy bringing all my friends here to try a new kbbq spot.   As soon as we sat down, we ordered all the meat cause we were hungry. We only ordered beef tongue and brisket to start. We had no idea it would take 25 minutes to bring out 2 plates of raw meat. We were fine for the first 15 minutes cause we had the small side dishes, but after that we had to say something to the waiters. They didn't bring it out for another 10 minutes. By then, the rice was already cold and the grill was so hot that the meat literally cooked in less than 10 seconds and stuck to the grill. It was like eating ground beef. It was one of my friend's first time, and she got so pissed that she left after one bite. Not to mention she asked for more sides when we asked about the meat, and they haven't even brought it out even after she left.  So we decided to order more meat. We asked to triple the last order and add pork and bulgogi  because we were a group of 6 (now 5). So we waited another 20 minutes. They gave us less meat than the first order?!?!? I was pissed. Sitting there for almost 50 minutes and they only took our meat orders twice and gave us less meat when we asked for more. I decided to complain to the manager. Never have I ever had that bad of an experience at kbbq. Most places may take a while to refill waters but they're usually quick with the meat. This place took forever to refill and bring out raw meat. How hard is it to bring out raw meat? They don't even cook it.  Then the waiter comes back and apologizes. Homeboy said "sorry I was lazy before but now I changed cause yea" we all looked at each other like wtf? Who says that? After that they were quicker on bringing out the meat. But by the third time we made our order it was already over an hour of sitting there munching on the sides and we were getting full. But we ordered a lot more just so we can try to get somewhat of our money's worth. We asked for double of 4 different meats. They still gave us less than the single order. They were a little quicker this time but it still took 10 minutes to bring out.   The waiter came back again and didn't even apologize. He made an excuse. He said the other table made a reservation so they were busier accommodating them. Wtf does having a reservation have anything to do with service? We waited like 20 minutes outside prior to eating. I guess you should make a reservation next time so they treat you better. Then he said we can't discount anything but we can give you free soda. Wtf is free soda gonna do? We were just fed up and asked for the check.  They charged us for 6 orders, even though it was only 5 of us eating cause our friend left before the meat came because the service was that horrible. They have some nerve adding auto gratuity for shitty service, I had to say something again.  I've eaten here multiple times and i usually am pleased with the experience. I don't know if it was because it was all guys working but they suck. Just standing around with their dick in their hands doing nothing and admitting to being lazy.

fsv3mGQYOBdu1fpRaXGrVg.text: I had a great time with my homies, even met some new homies. Came straight from work to relax, definitely hit the spot!

4V0pgF2EviyGpKOU5CgEHA.text: One of my favorite spots here in vegas! Great good, great service, what else can you ask for?? This place beats tofu hut and Korean gardens with no doubt. Btw, this is the only kbbq spot that I know where you can order a whole slab of rib eye!

U5ziEV3s-Z2_34ESNvzSbA.text: Great Food & Customer Service! AYCE Dinner for only $19.99, can't beat that for the quality and amount of food that you are getting :)

cGYWC1jBGlTYh1A3_6bWUQ.text: I've been to Tofu hut, Mothers best, Woo Chee, Honey Pig, and Sura, and this by far is the one of the better Korean bbq places in Vegas. I'm going to keep this short and simple. They brought out our orders on time, they kept bringing us water, and the food was delicious!! From their pork to chicken to different types of beef, it was all yummy. (Even the side dishes were all good ANDDD plentiful) The only reason for it being four stars was because their menu is fairly small and their brisket sauce definitely needed more salt. Other than that, as long as I ask for a side of salt everytime I sit down, I will continue going to this place! :)

uiSMXMAMctmeiHFRw-r1pA.text: This korean bbq place is very FANTASTIC! No word could explain their service, their food and the friendliness of staff despite of so many request from our table, their affogato is fantastic!!!! I can not wait to come back and try their fantastic food once again, we are very well taken care of! Once you get inside you will be happy when you are done! Excellent!!!!!!

-9U3jRNsW2x0z5cik8d3Uw.text: I don't give 5 stars very often but this place was good.  Now I am battling a cold and my taste buds are a lil slow but man this place was good.  Came for lunch so there was no wait(other Yelp reviews say its crazy busy).  The Meat The Meat The Meat.....keep bringing it!  I have never done the Korean BBQ thing but I was impressed.  Our serever Jasmin was very helpful on explaining what everything was......she recommonded the tounge but maybe if I did several shots of sake maybe I could give it a try......Hit this place up......I will be back.

_zEC2vt7cD5bdpvrTvwxQQ.text: I think this is just a standard Korean bbq place nothing special. But they do not serve beer or wine. I was told they're in the process of obtaining a alcohol license. Overall food and service was good
