yAp1ZeRfwqJY7hp3q_lONg.text: Came here on a busy Thursday night. To my surprise, our party of 8 was seated within 5 mins. Must try out of all KBBQ in Las Vegas! Server was very attentive and food came out quick!

E9xuGFFlQirh3V2AV70HVQ.text: Been to this place many times, long wait but its well worth the wait. Good service, fun experience def will be back again.

2YWJ93bvK_GK00-22EPzHA.text: I freaking love Korean BBQ, and this place was awesome.   I have to start by saying I came with a large group, because of that I will not comment on the service. I'm not saying the service is bad but I think it may have been super because they wanted us out of there. The restaurant is small and we took up a large chunk.   What I loved: Quality of the meat was great Flavor of the marinated meats like spicy pork was really nice and balanced.  They have garlic butter and little pots of cheese to get hot and melty, see photo.  Price, it's a great value.  I really appreciated unlike other places I've been it's a flat price, you see it you order it. No confusing tiers to flip back and forth though to check if the premium steak tier also includes pork belly...  They were fast and efficient with changing the grill and generous with the water refills.  The best part? When I got home my son hugged me and said "mom, you smell like meat." Ah yes son, I sure do love me some Korean BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

m0pjmpB0lI9WAw9AgoPrlA.text: This place might actually be my favorite korean bbq place!  I've tried tofu hut, gen bbq, hobak, and honey pig. This place has so many options!  52 menu items that includes appetizers, meats, sides and dessert!    My favorite meats are the skirt steak, pineapple beef, pork cheek and galbi. Also I love the shake shake rice.   Service is pretty good. They are nice and bring you food pretty promptly. However beware because they give you however many portion according to table size. So if you want a little of something just to try, let them know beforehand.

gvwVlMGMg1RgXrju_7xxLA.text: I love this place! My friends and I eat here all the time but tonight was probably the best experience we've had so far! 2MSBDTorDDhkNgm62cYlJg.text: Last night was the second time I went here and it was amazing as always and our server was great. The only but was that towards the end of our meal they told us there was a two hour wait rushing us to leave after paying and tipping. I have never been kicked out of a restaurant before and to be honest that was very rude when we were still enjoying our beer and good conversation. We were there for about an hour and half. I love this place but I probably won't be going again after this. Very disappointed.

THpkn5PrPMKpubJMMF89Bg.text: Loved this place tremendously! We've had some difficulty finding the right Korean BBQ since moving from California and now our search is over. Food is delicious, staff is super friendly and attentive. The green tea ice cream and spicy chicken were my favorite parts and we didn't experience any wait time luckily. It's nice when they sit you and already have your kimchi sides and grill ready to go for you.

bKobEXLwfFAFC1JZkuRrow.text: Not bad, good vibes but definitely not great for koreans. We came searching for good Korean BBQ but as guests of LV,  I used yelp to find a decent spot fo Korean food. Based off of the reviews we tried it out but it was subpar at most. The rice wasn't Korean rice, the portions we're tiny so you have to keep asking for the same meat. The pork belly was super thick, which is fine but definitely not old school koreans are used to. I would def recommend for younger groups but would not if you're with old school koreans aka parents and you're looking for some Korean food.

DJFC_-nHqDxc7r0j-Uo25g.text: Absolutely love this place go here every two weeks. Love the new remodel also. Only thing I dislike is the blasting loud music.

1yehiNoIq2h1YBPR2eI6JQ.text: This was my second time getting Korean BBQ after experiencing a subpar restaurant in California, and this one finally introduced me to what the hype is all about. Great quality meat and they have unique appetizers. It's a great value for all you can eat, but the service can be slow. When we were there, we noticed that there was really only 1-2 servers for all tables, and there was a long line of people waiting. Only come when you have time to spare.  Tip: if you check in on Yelp and write a review, you can get a free Korean beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. SO MUCH BRISKET!

tqNqJcyX7e-MXj1bx0B8QQ.text: This has been the second time I've been to Hwaro and if you haven't been here you're missing out!   I came with my coworkers who had been constantly raving about this place. They did all the ordering and I did all the EATING. From pork belly and brisket, to shake shake rice, don't forget to order rice paper on the side and try one their yummy alcoholic beverages too. AND GET THE SH!T. Get two orders for yourself, not one, cause you're gonna want more, trust me!   This place is always busy and the wait can be about 10-20 minutes since it's so small (they need to expand!!!!) Once you're seated, you have a variety of "toppings" and the circular stove is turned on. Containers of water are already waiting for you; now its just time to order the meats! Once your stove top gets too charred, someone will change it out for you.  The waiters have always been so sweet and very attentive!   It's a really cool experience if you've never had Korean BBQ before. Make sure to get the all you can eat. Brought my husband the second time and he absolutely loved it!!

3bd3hBl_DY6j-iTMm3cSNA.text: If's you love all you can eat Korean BBQ I really recommend here. But you cannot to reserve you have to come here and wait at the front but not to long maybe about 20-40 min it's depend How's busy. But the food is so good and very nice service.

6ATZLXbtIJPSzdjQrl1l2w.text: literally best korean bbq place i have been too. the price is on the affordable side of kbbq, plus YUMMY appetizers too- i've never gotten that from other places, only the meat options. on top of that the service is unbeatable!! everyone working there is so nice and a great character overall. would recommend this place to anyone.

t7zb4YGmQsab5srpFkJ7vw.text: It's not the greatest. But also not the worst. Our waitress had us waiting for water refill for over 20 mins. We also had to order the same order more than twice (because it never came the first time). And it wasn't even that busy. Just very disorganized. The food was great but cuts were thicker than most restaurants, so cooking is more time consuming. I definitely disagree with the automatic tip with just four people, especially since the service wasn't the greatest.

T9Su-r3NDB_7hmkRMYCrUg.text: Great Korean AYCE restaurant, very large selections of food and appetizers. Food was super tasty, great customer service and the restaurant is clean. I would definitely come back, the next time I visit Vegas. Give this place a try you won't be disappointed.

8AQYI9bre32OBG8cGqP2Og.text: Jehsica is amazing at her job. Covered all bases and left no questions. And shes very pretty

Kpew9ypQh7u9BMewWEmtKg.text: Came here for Late night griLLing|grub sesh after waLking the strip. Good reviews on YeLp and them cLosing at 3AM made this a no-brainer. [AYCE was the cherry ontop!!!]   Our party of two arrived @ about 1:35 and was toLd that Last caLL was at 2AM. WompWompWomp.  At this time in the night and due to the hangry-ness that was kicking in, we gave it a go anyhow and just hoped for the best.  Jayden was our server and he was poLite and extremeLy patient. I urged my man to just order an ish-Load of food and caLL it a night since we were given such a smaLL time constraint. Our server kindLy stepped in and mentioned that we were free to order whatever we wanted but there wouLd be a charge at the end with whatever food was Left over [keep this in mind peopLe].  The banchan came out first and aLthough everything was good, the fish cake (which is normaLLy my fave) was simpLy ok and there was no japchae offered [Boooooo!!!!].  That being said, the other foods that came out were AMAZING. Meats were weLL marinated and I didn't need any dipping sauces. The absoLute highLight of the night were the buLgogi and Korean ribs.   We'LL make a trip back, especiaLLy to try the Affogato ice cream with Korean coffee.  (We were bummed to find out that this item was incLuded in the "Last CaLL" notice too). UntiL next time Hwaro.....

31tu28Pj0WSr8JrYu-uufQ.text: My first time going to this KBBQ spot last night and I was super impressed! There was a really good selection and the food was great as well. fDvLKkVWAaSpvumBMrKoCw.text: Surprisingly amazing! But first....the worst part...the parking!!! There's too many great restaurants in this plaza so give yourself plenty of time to find parking as well as wait time since it's a first come basis. Price is reasonable for an ayce bbq but the part that puts them over the top, the extras on the menu. Not only do you get the meats n the Korean side dishes, you get kfc (Korean fried chicken), there cheese fondue, shake shake box( rice,Kim chee, egg) soup, and so much more. They also have rice paper that I notice only Gen would have. The staff is amazing and quick with everything, very friendly.   So the reason I only gave 3 stars...we had to wait an hour half. I'm ok with that and that's normal on a busy night but I wasn't able to purchase soju while I wait!!! I always do this when I know the wait will be long. They don't allow it. Secondly (the main reason) while I was waiting I tragically witnessed the most disgusting way the staff cleans the tables. They used a dirty rag to wipe off the old food that was pulled out from his apron. And the another dirty rag to wipe the table again. Thank gosh I carry wet wipes with me to rewipe our table. Ok maybe that part was the worst part about this review.

sGf_0_HLtyTY5DMExef7Dw.text: Cant beat Hwaro for it's price. Great meat selection and we always get the Shake shake rice. Great complement to the BBQ. 0OF3KvF_rlcsl-4Clf7M0w.text: Was in town for work and stopped by for a late lunch.   The place was empty bc it was around 3.  They don't allow parties of 1.  Lame.    Walked next door to Monta  Noodle house for some of the best Ramen ever!

4mnMRqy0wMXrytkqfuz0Yw.text: UPDATE:  4/1/16: Went back last Friday and had a friend with me so I could "qualify" to sit at the Grill and do AYCE.  Noticed on the front door that they put up a sign saying that Grill and AYCE is for 2 or more persons, and even offering an apology if you don't meet this requirement.  To be fair, I've come across another Korean BBQ place that holds the same policy.  Once seated I noticed that they changed the grills from the rectangular ones that survived through 3 previous ownership changes, to the 14" rounded types with holes on the outer perimeter.  I also noticed that they reduced the number of grill stations as well, so I can understand now why they are limiting the grills to parties of two or more.  Ordered the Bulgogi (it's labeled as "ribeye" on the menu) and the Kalbi Ribs.  I prefer LA Style Kalbi, but this place has the traditional cut.  I've posted pictures before of their beautiful presentation, but now it's just thrown in a metal bowl and served to you.  We actually ordered 2 bowls of Bulgogi because the portions are modest, which is okay since it'll prevent waste.  The Bulgogi was marinated nicely, but the Kalbi ribs were a bit too thick, and the meat a bit rubbery.  I ordered the brisket and it came nice a thin shaved.  I like Bibim Bap sauce on my brisket so they were nice enough to bring me some on the side.  My friend likes salt & pepper on his rice (don't ask, I didn't) and they actually brought a bowl of salt/pepper mix from the kitchen for him.  My friend wanted chicken, so we ordered the Dak Gui.  It was a disappointment, just two breasts that were butterfly cut, and no marinade, so I used the sesame oil and pepper sauce that was given on the side to try and infuse some flavor.  They also didn't provide any garlic as well.  Good thing I had the Bibim Bap sauce to give the chicken some kick.  I'm upgrading from the previous 2-star rating, but not returning the original 4-star rating.  The food has gone downhill.  There was no soup or egg souffle like last time, the bancha was limited (no cucumbers or anchiovis) and the Kalbi and Dak Gui were disappointments.  Also, the floors continue to be a problem, as they remain slippery like someone waxed the floors with a layer of Crisco, which makes rubber soled shoes as slippery as teflon.  The pricing is still great at $20 for AYCE dinner, so that'll keep bringing people in, but there are definitely better joints out there as far as quality goes.  UPDATE:  1/22/16:   Unfortunately Hwaro's ego has gotten too big for its own good.  Stepped in yesterday for a late lunch, and despite seeing 4 open grills, was told that I couldn't get a grill as they are for parties of 2 or more only.  Ok, so I asked if AYCE is still available at a non-grill station, and was told no.  Wow, took my business elsewhere (Trattoria Nakamura-Ya which was a far better choice) and will continue to do so until this place sees its 4th owner, which shouldn't be too long.  Once gave this place 4 Stars, but taking it down two notches since I received no service at all.  FIRST REVIEW:  5/19/15: Been eating Korean BBQ at this locale for over 8 years and 3 previous owners.  Just walking in and seeing the new decor gave this place some much needed style, decor, ambiance and personality.  The wait staff was very friendly, and the food came fresh to the table, prepared and presented excellenty from their owner/chef who was the Head Chef at the Shila(sp) Hotel in Korea.  Nestled in the Seoul Plaza, which is quickly becoming Tokyo Plaza with nearby big-hitters like Raku, Raku Sweets, Monta Ramen, Trattoria Nakamura-Ya and Kabuto Edomae Sushi residing with them, it's nice to know that there's an actual Korean joint that can hold it's own weight in this plaza of Yelp Celebrities.  Add this to the list of places I'll send my friends to.  If this inspires you at all to check out Hwaro, please tell Nali (which others also pronounce as Nari and Naughty) I said hello as she doesn't believe me when I told/promised her I would give them props on Yelp!

Enjoyed the pork cheeks, beef things, (sorry, it was like rib meat)  it was damn good.   Sides were good and tasty but the were tight on the steamed eggs.  I got over that with the red wine pork belly...  Enjoyed it.!!

The sides were good too, not too spicy, glad it was like that though. Servers were nice and really friendly. This is the 2nd place on my list of AYCE korean bbq restaus out here.

Mb1rkfyfLwmyLO2BL5YknQ.text: This place is always awesome and this is a great promotion to get some beer and good reviews! But honestly I love this place!

tH47x4cMyhieZi_UZE9abg.text: Excellent service, food was great and price is awesome !! the owner is humble with her customers. They have a special sauce for the meat that is ready to eat. It was spectacular. Bottomline I recommend this place if you're looking for AYCE KBBQ

NItyWxe4AIlLwaifRgcAdQ.text: My boyfriend and I really wanted kbbq for lunch the other day and were torn between so many places because there are so many options for AYCE. We ultimately decided on Hwaro and holy crap I'm so happy we did. We hardly had to wait (maybe 10 min max) and we love how extensive Hwaro's menu is. I love that they have their lunch menu pricing available on weekends as well. We ended up paying the all-day price since we wanted the LA galbi, but it was worth it.   We ordered brisket, tongue, LA galbi, jalapeno garlic beef belly, a random ass steak, and lots more LA galbi. We also got their bean paste soup, onion salad, steamed egg, and some rice paper. We love ssamjang and were pleasantly surprised by how good the ssamjang was here. The place was crowded, but the servers were as attentive and friendly as they could be. The quality of meat is pretty decent (not the best, but far from the worst) and they listen if you want only a small portion or if you want to order a big portion.   For $30/person (this includes tax and tip), this was a pretty great deal. Next time I'll definitely try the shake shake rice.

fZ3rtTMkZWweBP2ePOAh2w.text: This place is super cool; smells delicious. Do not order too much rice; the meat is going to fill you up fast.  Dessert was the best; especially after the meat sweats.   Come in cool/comfortable attire

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Can&#39;t wait!! All I can eat

iujo_oOWYfcspBW8u7ucJw.text: Friendly Staff and efficient service. Basic price of $19.95 for lunch is generous and you can upgrade for a wider meat selection. I love the pork neck and the pork belly. Rib eye is so tender and juicy. I will definitely come back.

_hXwKJBms-MH0KZdWLxs3g.text: Moved to Vegas couple months ago and still searching for Korean BBQ and finally I found my spot "HWARO" which this place is all you can eat. Price is really decent which you can get good quality of meat compare to other Korean bbq place in Las Vegas.  We got there after busy hour which we waited only 30min to get seated. Compare to LA Korean bbq service was way better here and also the server knows what they are doing. My server "Tyler" which he was our main server he took care of everything. Getting all the side dishes when they are about to be empty and changing grills everytime when we needed. We thought that "Tyler" was the manager at Hwaro which he took care of other tables with professional manners but he told us he was a just server. I'm going to definitely tell my friends from LA or here in Vegas to try out wonderful place "Hwaro" and our best server "Tyler".  Thank you for the great experience Hwaro.

9v6TxZAGasNIfT3asFLoPA.text: I usually go to Hobak but I decided to try an all you can eat KBBQ spot.  My friend always goes to this joint so I decided to tag along.  All you can eat is $23 bucks and you really can't find a better deal.  The quality of meat isn't as good as Hobak but what would one expect with it being all you can eat.  Everything we ordered was really good especially the beef belly & the short rib.  Their service is stupid fast, they come around and ask if you want more and it literally comes out within a couple minutes.    Their garlic butter is super good, especially after you let the garlic boil in the butter.  The texture is similar to like a soft potato LOL.    I'd definitely come here when I'm feeling extra hungry and don't want to do a la carte.  4 stars because the steamed egg was a little watery & quality of meat was decent.

inQPCCOF3yDRjMpLUM2YMQ.text: Greta food and service! This is my place if i ever crave korean Bbq. They have different meats and the ayce price is really cheap. I love it here!! 10/10 recommend this place

dEHP96a6PB6NL8E1o_4C-g.text: Love this restaurant! First Korean BBQ and I can't get enough when we go. Was recommended by a friend, Service is very nice and attentive ready to bring your order, refill your pitcher, and change your grill. The squid it is my favorite followed along with their fish cakes, It seems as if I have developed an addiction to them! Was not disappointed at all! Would recommend 100%

C7OSjv3MDMJKSkTWkLYg-Q.text: It's unlimited food, so don't expect the best cuts but foe the price, definitely not bad! Check in to get a free drink. Service is fast and good!

wlxo4Qj7TXmns6KOzoVq9Q.text: Ok, I don't usually do reviews but I am so upset. First: the quality of the meat is pretty good and the signature sauce is sooo amazing along with the sides. So you know someone in the kitchen is doing something right. However the waitress is what made my visit not that great. She started off really polite but then kept coming back to my table constantly checking and trying to give us the check 40 min since we were seated. I asked a male waiter what is the limit here and he said 90min so I was confused on As to why my boyfriend and I were being rushed. She then offered to COOK FOR US I hesitated and said we're just going to take a break and she replied "ready for ice cream?" Like how does a break translate to check please??? But the MOST UPSETTING PART was when she'd take our plate of meats and just throw it on the grill when we weren't even ready to cook it or even consume it, she ended up cooking our SKIRT STEAK which is pork and "cooked it" by cutting it up in small pieces and burning the sides little did we know we'd get FOOD POISONING. The atmosphere of the place is nice, the workers are nice, the food is nice, the Filipino waitress possibly named Jasmine? Less than satisfactory. I recommend this place but just don't let anyone cook for you even if Gordon Ramsay shows up

R7Np05jp-BdH9va4sfQekw.text: I was introduced to Hwaro a year ago by a friend/coworker and have been going since. It's definitely my go to KBBQ when I'm ready to splurge (its still pretty inexpensive at around 26$ for all you can eat) and just have an awesome night with friends. The atmosphere makes for a very social place, making it great for parties (have had several birthdays here).   I've been recently and noticed a change in staff, but  the atmosphere still stays friendly. I had gone the other night with some friends and family that weren't familiar with all you can eat style KBBQ and the server, Tyler, was awesome making sure they felt comfortable, made sure the waters and drinks kept coming, and had noticed that he even helped through out the floor with other tables!   As a local and regular I would recommend going to this KBBQ spot, but make sure to get there early for dinner because it gets PACKED.

8-O16H0--41H8RHtFLYlVg.text: Two option for early birds, lunch all you can is 18.99, the everything is 22.99, we got the everything. I was a little disappointed in the premium steak one order per person, too much fat and it was pretty thin. Other then that the food was good and flavorful, the best part is the service is very good and everyone was super nice.

1I20zcsI71vb58TPNCdKYw.text: Food was great! Service was mediocre (not really available), but the staff was friendly. All-u-can eat quality is good. Will definitely bring people who like Korean food here. Get there early or you will have a long wait time and go with an empty stomach.

ZbtwfajK3hMOMml1BThtnA.text: This is probably my favorite boba spot in town. If you're going to get some boba, this is the place to do it. Our cashier was able to give us some great guidance and was especially helpful for pairing boba with our drinks. Everything you've heard is 100% True and then some! Obviously the boba is the main event, and every time I go it's top notch - juicy and perfectly crafted. Don't skip the crepes! The housemade crepes are out-of-this-world good, so save room on your main boba!

SvHLjxk6M57MGB_4efJGHg.text: I visited this place when it first opened. We came in the afternoon and the place was fairly spacious and for the most part, empty. This was actually a welcome change from waiting in crammed spaces for hours. The booths looked clean and the decor modern. The service was very much on point and they were extremely attentive. I guess my main gripe was the quality and lack of flavor in the meats. We sampled practically all of the offerings including the marinated and non marinated options. Everything lacked flavor completely. I actually found their banchan more enjoyable than the meats themselves. I don't think this will become a regular place for our Korean BBQ fix unfortunatley.

_8Q3bh37jl6_tRpJGHXHYQ.text: I'm a sucker for KBBQ so when a family member suggested this place to me on my last night in town, you know I had to try it. First off, the parking is impossible...it's tiny and no one leaves. So I had my bf drop me off so I could put our names down while he found parking. He circled the lot about 10 times before he gave up and went to find parking in a nearby lot.   The wait was about 30-45 min for 3 people but we did go at a busy time (6:30-7). The indoor area was tiny so we had to wait outside, and it was freezing! We were finally seated at a table closest to the door and we couldn't wait to dig in. At first it was a little awkward cause we were so close to the door and the people waiting were literally staring/watching me eat.   The menu had the most variety I've ever seen for an AYCE, they had specialty items (which do have caps on how many can be ordered), meats, soups & sauces. The $hit is a must try! I enjoyed the bulgolgi nachos which were basic but delicious. & the premium steak was the perfect amount of fat to meat ratio.   I wish I didn't come here cause now I can't get anything close to as good as this was. I will make it a point to eat here every time I'm in town.

hiOJdH2knNHhzrfUmHToDw.text: First time trying this place out I really enjoyed the food and the service. Janice was out waiter and her customer service was impeccable. Even my 15 month old daughter enjoyed the place although she couldn't eat much of the food. The meat was so juicy and fresh and all these different sides we were able to mix it with. "The shit" was SO good we had to do 2 orders so I highly recommend. I love the fact they change the grill after a certain amount of time and replace it with a new one. Definitely will be back for more!!

odnhINP1RRy_etZcxIbh2Q.text: A BBQ place where I need to wait at least 20minutes every time. But it is worth to wait. The food is so good. BTW, short rib is my favor

kniKel01TkZ2TLf26WDl5A.text: Hate to say it, the best out of the ones we always go too. This place is also happening all the time. Food is awesome, lots of options and if the wait is long you know it's the place to be

fbfP6PS3wXnVX02--U6Ulw.text: Went here with my wife on a date night.  My favorite was the skirt steak but all the items we tried were delicious.  Service was very good.  Key things I appreciate the most in a restaurant.  Only draw back is they don't have the traditional Korean salad like other places and no japchae.  I would still come back though.  A colleague of mine raved about this place and it didn't disappoint!  Also for dessert, we had the green tea ice cream which was better than most places and the affogato which was also very good!

-IS2Jw4zZp0pF6D_JSXu9A.text: Definitely best Korean bbq I'm the city, my friends always want to meet here and when they call me I always go. I went to this place with open mind and it didnt disappoint so if you like to cook food yourself and eat as much as you can then go to this place. When its busy you have to wait and its ok because it is good. And the servuce is very nice and helpful. That's what you need to do is go to here when you are hungry and eat all you can.

PON9rbDQykpsRPsfajhJsA.text: We were spoiled. We came here first. So when we went to the other restaurant...maybe we expected too much. The service here was amazing. Sammie and Jacob (there was one more but I can't remember her name) were amazing and super attentive. They worked as a team to meet our every need and they definitely went above and beyond the call of duty to provide amazing service. We had a group of over 15 people and they never made us wait too long for anything we asked for....we asked for a lot too!   If you're going to go to ANY KBBQ place in LV, this is the one to go too. The menu prices were much more reasonable, the service is spot on, the ambiance is fun (though if you're looking for a quiet place, it can get a little loud). The meat quality was pretty good for the price you were paying. The only thing I'd say was a little bit troublesome is that if you liked the baby octopus or enoki beef, they come in only limited supply. I wasn't torn up about that because I wanted the other selections a lot more. But being an AYCE place...these kinds of limitations just leave you a bit wanting.

I asked, as a courtesy because we do come here often just to pay half price as that is is something they offer per the info above; however, they refused! NO SYMPATHY AT ALL!!

Lots of choices for appetizers and meats, and great quality. It's a loooong wait during rush dinner times, we waited almost an hour but we were determined. Try the KFC and the shit, and the brisket is so delicious.

BUQDEaKvtn4kFtm6EUt-EA.text: Smaller place but seated us after 10 minutes. Beef bulgogi was great! Plenty of selections - 54 for dinner menu and 39? For lunch.

HZSZy54D227qLoz9S5n9Vg.text: High expectation, under delivered.  When I first walked in, I enjoyed the smells, the super hero themes, Korean rap music. Yelp never failed to deliver quality value restaurants in terms of high reviews.  Food smells great, like any other Korean bbq establishment with the normal Korean bbq menus.  My wife and I decided to come here today, but service was at a snail's pace, and we waited over 1 hour before being seated, when I see 4 - 5 empty tables.  They could have been understaffed, so it might have been a focus on the quality of service, but the service was still below average.  My expectations are usually very minimal.  In fact, I expect at least average service with average food (for a Korean bbq establishment) and I would give 4 to 5 stars.  My mind may change after another visit, but my current feeling about the establishment is underwhelming.

3apW8JDfwsslhtJ38hIoxA.text: All you can eat Korean BBQ!! Staff is very accommodating. My favorite was "the shit" and brisket.

gAsXk_APS3HWo9rH2j6VBA.text: I've eaten at this place twice now and had a great meal both times.  It is VERY popular so get there early or prepared to wait a bit.  The selection and quality is MUCH better than Gen.  (sorry Gen Phan bois).    If you actually know how to cook, this place is much more versatile and appealing. Getting oils, garlic, butter, and spices to add at your pleasure and taste.

QJ3QsJ0AyQgcSJ63jpDdsw.text: This has always been our favorite Korean BBQ joint. Meat quality is good, staff can be overwhelmed at times but offer exceptional service. Our recent visit today was short due to a unwelcome guest. A live roach was skittering across the wall beside us. The roach made its way to the table near our grill. Our group immediately left the table, after soon losing our appetites. We brought the attention to a nearby staff member who apologized for the inconvenience but could only accommodate us free drinks. We did not finish our meal. The entire situation seemed dismissed and was taken lightly. When speaking to their manager his reply was "OK" and did not charge us for "leftovers". As a result our group will no longer return this loved place. Very disappointing!...   If you don't mind a potential pest ruining your dinner, this is the place for you. Good luck!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Unwelcome pest joined us for dinner. We soon left the table and did not even finish our meal due to loss of appetite.

QqRYMJTiVYQZ4tUd2vxI8g.text: This is our usual spot for korean BBQ. When it comes to space it's limited so high wait time.. As far as the food, its good but the meats can be of better quality I feel.. But, for the price you pay.. You do get your moneys worth!Service is okay..I feel they are so busy sometimes hard to be very attentive for all customer needs! But, overall a good experience each time!

LNvgU1YHFgFczsDZLJyxnw.text: Me and my guy went late night after work. It was a fun, casual atmosphere. The servers weren't the most attentive and didn't really seem in the mood to describe menu items and answer questions. We tried the shake shake rice witch I thought was a super clever presentation of kimchi fried rice. But at the end of the day, it was just average kimchi fried rice. I like that the AYCE portions are small. It gives you the opportunity to try a lot of different items and not fill up on just 2 or 3 like other Korean BBQ places in town.  All in all, I'll come back. But only for the fact that it's open late and allows me to eat something tasty and wholesome for a good price.

nJSIduM1DVSaUSzqIJIptw.text: Food was just amazing and the customer service was outstanding. First time here and I will be back again, try something new next time.

7gSGPFTezIXnUN5v5AE6eA.text: Pretty sure this restaurant would fall apart if it wasn't for Janice. She basically does everyone's job.  If you don't sit in her section then you are a fart face... and you'll be waiting for your food forever.   Good food. Good service.

btsDdE73JB-M95rDJkTPVg.text: My 100th review! We enjoyed going to Hwaro for our ladies night out. Parking is a bit of a pain though and since the restaurant is kind of small you usually have a little bit of a wait for a table. We waited about 25 minutes for our table but conveniently they have some tables for you to sit at while you wait for a table with a grill.   Love that before you even sit down they bring all the side dishes out for you to start munching on. The service was friendly and attentive. The meat selection was vast. The ribeye and baby octopus were my favorite dishes. They were marinated with perfection and were fun to cook.   Everything was pretty good just wish they had more of a selection of desserts as part of the AYCE. The green tea ice cream wasn't my favorite but then again I'm picky with my green tea ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Baby octopus

WpKmoE9FuF2n5u8p5hYjxQ.text: Staff is amazing and the food is good! This is the first place I tried Korean BBQ and I fell in love.   All the meat I tried was fresh and good quality.   There was an ice cream I had with coffee and I think like Frosted Flakes or something. Whatever it was, it was BOMB!   Usually a long wait and not a lot of parking, but it's worth it.

ZZwThvSKgTn0cZeZN0yhSw.text: Hwaro is my favorite all you can eat bbq in Vegas! Prepare yourself to leave smelling like delicious Korean food.  FOOD: Every table is served many Korean side dishes. The fish cake is my absolute favorite. They also give you salad. I like the quality of their meats and how they marinate everything. The brisket and red wine pork belly are my favorites. I highly trying the Shake Shake Rice that comes in a box for you to shake before eating. The cheese corn is a great option if you're a cheese lover like me. My family is a big fan of the spicy bean soup. Oh and the bulgogi nacho is a must try!  DRINK: The Peach Soju is a very popular drink here.  ATMOSPHERE: Expect at least an hour to two hour wait for a table during dinner time. Do not expect good service here. The place is always busy. I like the look of the restaurant and I like to come here with friends and family because it's a fun meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Korean bbq
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Shake Shake Rice (rice, korean sauce, &amp; egg served in a box for you to shake before eating)

MArnLhDgaN0eG7RqAnY3Cg.text: My wife was craving Korean BBQ when I got home tonight, so instead of going to the places we've been, I asked if we can go somewhere new, a place that I've booked marked. This place was one of the many I have book marked and we were both excited to try.   We even brought our Air BnB guest with us to try it out for our first time. The drive wasn't bad at all from where we live. The parking in the plaza fills up quick so I suggest going early or later. Not during prime time dinner hours.   When we arrived, it wasn't packed. Not even a wait. We signed in and was seated quickly. Looked like we came at a good time.   The service was great. Very attentive and got our table set up quickly and replaced dishes when asked, and took away dirty dishes when done. We didn't have to wait long for our meats at all.   We ordered the brisket and bulgogi, and steamed egg among the already dished our sides. The Bulgogi was delicious. Brisket was dry in my opinion. The steamed egg was a disappointment though. To me, it tasted very grainy almost like sand. I had my wife and our new friend try to, they tasted some grainy but nothing that would cause a concern. To me it wasn't bearable. I couldn't finish it.   All in all, I definitely recommend. I will be back!

GCNWuhi5r3eHgG0YG-Cs0A.text: Hwaro... What can I say? It's a $20 AYCE Korean BBQ place.   $20 you say....I say YUP...$20!!! :)  So at this price of you are expecting the high end quality cuts of beef...Uumm..... What you been smoking??? Cuz you should really share! Lol j/k!!! :D  But saying all that, the quality of the beef is not bad... It's actually decent. All the meat that I have tried were good. Tender... Not tough... And flavorful. Try the different marinated ones...like the red wine pork belly... I loved the different dipping sauces but I gotta say that the sesame oil with the salt is always my go-to sauce. Just start getting you meat and get your meat on!!  The side dishes were delicious!! Don't forget to ask for the garlic and the jalapenos...I love to eat them raw but you can grill them for extra flavor. Also get the shake shake rice... Just a tip... If you have leftover side dishes... Add them to the box before shaking and enjoy!! It's kind of like a fun bibimbop...Lol my favorites were the salad and the steamed egg... Steamed egg... So yummy!!!   It always has a long wait... So be prepared to wait... But I normally put my name on the list and go-to kung fu tea to get a tea... So that I have something to do.   And be prepared to leave stinking like the yummy Korean meats that are grilled there... But hey... It's a price that I'll pay anytime...$20 for AYCE... Yup I'll definitely be back!!

KH-P4fTdrIJy5ehgnaQdsg.text: This is my absolute favorite KBBQ place!! Every time I try any other KBBQ restaurant, it just makes me miss Hwaro more.  I literally liked every single thing I was served; everything from the salad, the sides and especially the sauce. I even liked their kimchi, and I'm not usually a fan.   The service is also another factor that makes this place so great. They were attentive, friendly, and didn't feel like they were too busy to serve you. Which was especially admirable since it was a bit packed when we went.  Overall, we waited an hour, but I'm not even mad. It was worth it, and I would still recommend Hwaro to anyone looking for a fantastic KBBQ place.

jI_GVENElODYaNF98zBlYQ.text: My favorite AYCE KBBQ spot in town.  Pricing:   - All Day Specials (aka normal dinner) - $22.99 - Late Night Special (10-3am) - $19.99  The main difference between the two is that some of the more expensive meats are not on the late night specials (notably Beef Tongue and Short-rib)  Pros:  -Appetizers are very tasty & offer a change up from the usual BBQ. - Large restaurant, so the wait time is not horrible, but can get long on the weekends at night. - Speedy Service - Large menu  Cons: - Parking is a PAIN. The plaza has 4-5 very good restaurants, so parking here during dinner time can be a nightmare, you've been warned. -Don't always have rice paper (they run out sometimes)  Menu Items I like a lot:  -Beef Belly -Pineapple Marinated Steak -Enoki Wrapped Beef -The SHIT! (That's what it called..) -Corn Cheese -Brisket -Pork Cheek  Dessert: -affogato (espresso & vanilla ice cream)  My go-to spot for KBBQ. Reasonable price and a large variety of tasty food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Big draw of KBBQ is that you cook your own meat to your liking. Left to right: -Enoki wrapped in beef -Beef Brisket -Pork Belly
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Short Rib
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Assorted Meats to grill

XPtDRCF_14DrooQ1iJJBVg.text: Came here after a 8 mile hike and a 2 hour drive, so we were ready to eat! We waited about a hour for 3 people. It's a very popular place so we expected a wait. They have a huge menu of meats and appetizers and they give you 90 mins to stuff yourself, just don't leave too many left overs or they will charge you extra. We got so many different types of meat but my favorite was the premium steak which is pretty much a whole ribeye, galbi (short ribs) and the skirt steak. The quality of meat was great for a AYCE spot. Service was on point. Will def stop by the next time I'm in Vegas.

jFd3fABgvjNaxJveMQCfYA.text: Love this place! One of the best Korean BBQ I've been to.   I took a star off because it was very hot in the restaurant because of the little space and lots of heat from everyone cooking.   Other than that, I love the environment. The food was delicious and fresh. I love the all you can eat with the many different meat choices.   The affagato was delicious too!!

BICf8F_cFA34Ll_rQTaB0g.text: For the price, this place is amazing!!!! Always packed and there will be wait time I warn you but it's worth it. They play all kinds of music from kpop to American. The servers are so cute and nice, plus the food is delicious. My fav is the bulgogi and the green tea ice cream.

1UztfcyWEx56C6fp9EIwcQ.text: This is the best Korean BBQ that I had ever been to so far. The price of the food compared to the type of meal you will have is a steal.  The food was delicious, they have a different variety cuts of meat and flavors, their generously portion and the meat is not so thin that it breaks when you lift it off the grill. The only thing I don't like about this place is the wait time since the restaurant is small.  Please open another location and a bigger space on the Southwest side of the valley.

wgB3wbZqi7qmxRAyOdHurA.text: Sometimes a girl just wants to eat her feelings. I had high hopes for this place. But wouldn't let me eat solo. Sighs. Next time i guess.

acQn-MTwJd0k-kQXjGLWlA.text: I've missed eating Korean bbq since I've moved here from LA. This place isn't bad at all for the price. Got here around 330pm, parking lot is small for the area, so I can see this becoming a problem if you want to come here later in the night.   Place was pretty empty. I thought the decor was really nice and we got to sit on the table that was on a platform, which was nice.  I really like the steel round grill as opposed to the rectangular black grill. Meat cooks faster and if it's done I like to push it the edge of the round grill, so they don't get burnt.    The highlights for me were the steamed egg, kimchi, corn cheese, beef tongue, and the marinated squid. I feel like in LA not many places serve beef tongue.  So it was a treat to see it being served here.  The key is to cook it just when it turns slightly brown,  cook it too long and it can be rubbery and tough.    The marinated squid was pretty awesome.  And the corn cheese had really good mayo/onion flavor and not too sweet which I love. Kimchi was yummy and sour. I also like that they provide us with plenty of sesame oil/dipping sauce and bottles of ice water, so we don't have to always ask for more.  I think it's cool that ice cream is included.  Not many bbq places offer that.  I prefer the green tea,  the plum one reminds me of pink bubblegum I used to eat as a kid hehe.   The brisket was too fatty. So we didn't order more of it. We also tried one of the marinated meats, too sweet. I think I just prefer eating plain meat.  The pork belly was ok, also more on the fatty side.    Overall it was a good experience. I would definitely come back again for my Korean bbq fix :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Green tea and plum ice cream
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

jX3ptQN3-Gmt4h7mO0Z_6w.text: Came here for dinner for some yummy juicy AYCE Korean barbeque. Plenty of tables when we arrived and was sat down immediately.  Server that served us was really nice. Asked us what drinks we want and came back with it quite quickly. The menu simple and easy to read and ordered a few appetizers such as seaweed salad and the sh*t  both dishes was delicious. Highly recommend trying the sh*t.  Ordered a few plates of meat and it cooked on our grill at a fair amount of time. The amount of meat they gave us each time was decent and the wait time for the next plate balanced out our eating time.  They also offer dessert here and we ordered a bowl of ice cream. I appreciate how this place offers appetizers, main course and dessert with a price of one AYCE.   This is probably one of my favorite AYCE Kbbq place because of the price, the marinated meat and the dessert.

iFs7CKmReMxxGfsgAf9n3Q.text: The shit is the shizznit. What else can I say Neil cooked everything for everybody.

nRgxxp-AYOrlJPNEVVWzWg.text: i come here frequently with friends~ it's a lovely place to eat, everything is super good, the servers are super nice, too. i think our server last time was jirro? i think that was his name? either way he was really funny and cool and recognized me and my brother from the last time we had gone. everything is lovely about this place, from the fact that it's the best KBBQ in vegas, you guys have excellent customer service, to the fact that last time i was there, they played nothing but red velvet.

r_XqqWaJuedrSYyAPgTh5Q.text: Really enjoyed this place, we'll priced and they also offered us more and more food. That's excalty how I like to treated in ayce spot. I diffently recommend and will come back.

K_bV_Lo0TXtJQjlxZAhg7w.text: I don't know why I love this place so much, lol. It's my go-to KBBQ spot. Service is a little slow though, but I like this place better than Sura and others. One time I went there two days in a row, 'coz I'm fat like that.. and the guy recognized me and started laughing with his co-worker and saying something in Korean (which were probably along the lines like, "DAMN Look at this fatass,") really obvious. I'll bring my Google Translate next time. Look Mr Judgey-Mcjudger.. don't judge me. I should take a star out 'coz I felt uncomfortable for a total of 3 minutes. Then i stuffed my mouth with beef again and forgot all about it.

8sqO8r4VFRPjJr_NVmD0NA.text: My new favorite korean bbq! It's AYCE at a very affordable price. IMO, hwaro is better than sura. I love the food!!! Service is great(once you are seated lol). The only problem is the place is always crowded/busy, hence the long wait, I think we waited for 30 mins. or so before we were seated. But overall, I still give it two thumbs up

KLmaNE0-cI3_6yNAvHMRKA.text: The selection is great and the marinade for the meat is delicious. Highly recommend the brisket and steak.

mPbI1qjxsxFYOG1z_uqV4A.text: The food was really good. Didn't have to wait a long time and the employees are very nice. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.

nZer0aCyFA9m7j0txpkJdw.text: Awesome food, all you can eat! That also includes a dessert The affogato is amazing. Doesn't get to smokey like traditional BBQs.

nEup-JtNgWtENwqeca7UHw.text: If you compare almost any kbbq place to LA's variety... you can give them 3.5-4 stars. For a kbbq spot in Vegas terms.. this is actually really good! Hwaro is a busy location like any other ayce place, but in my opinion it offers the best variety! I've only been here once which was couple days ago, but safe to say I will be back again. It is located on spring mt which is its only downside due to horrible drivers and lack of parking, but once you get beyond that it's not bad. Expect a wait from atleast 10-20 min on a normal day. My girlfriend and I went on a Thursday afternoon and it was only 10 minutes. The servers were pretty busy, so we did not get the most amazing service. That was not a problem because they are only human and have to cater to other customers as well. When the servers were with us I can tell they did their best to accommodate our needs and get us what we wanted in a timely manner. When I go to kbbq I usually get the briskets, pork belly, and for this location the skirt steak. The meats were decent quality and definitely better than tofu hut or doh. They actually have a way bigger variety including side dishes such as "the shit." Try "the shit" it is very good. They do a good job on changing your grill. The ayce price was $18.99 (correct me if I'm wrong). I will definitely be back to try their other options!

yTGQUfsHSTTubG9gvKsU1Q.text: Very hip place with Korean pop music. Good deal for AYCE and the selection of meat. Great customer service. Parking can be a drag but there's also street parking available behind the buildings. Overall, we had a great experience and would come again.

kIn_5J4EC5EwRjevEeAoQg.text: I can eat brisket all day. I'm writing thru my gfs Yelp account lol because our awesome server gave thumbs up for free sapporos for 2. Cheers y'all. Hwaro you rock!

6tViHN0VZfMpFaDP3gBW1g.text: This place is the best for AYCE Korean BBQ!!! They have a wide variety of side dishes, appetizers, and meats. The price and customer service is the best hands down!

jSVKYuFtpId8yCH5-Q7F1w.text: I'm super white so obviously I don't count. But this place is out of control. Amazing and amazing tasting food. Defiantly a must.  I will be back fo sho.

tONIJ-zhNft7_QZCN6tYCQ.text: My favorite Korean BBQ in Vegas! Literally come back every week. The All You Can Eat menu is abundant in different types of beef, pork and seafood.

OAMuL0_1pJl_fZp7UG77Cg.text: My all time favorite!! Can't go any other Korean BBQ place. $23 for 54 iTranslate to choose from, what else you can ask for

sJ_rppuUczeMtZM6NqMlSQ.text: This place is probably the best Korean BBQ AYCE restaurant i have been to.  Very reasonable price considering the quality and variety of food offered.  If you have a large party then be prepared to wait as they only have two tables that seat large groups.  Must try the shits and korean fried chicken.  End the meal with coffee poured over vanilla ice cream.

sBAq5XnR0bMN2pvJWCXz7w.text: Looove the bulkogi!!  Amazing atmosphere friendly knowledgeable staff meats are yummy and less fatty than neighboring competitors.

-_qj0HFSJK8Tvh_sh53iKA.text: My family and I been coming here for a long time and it never seems to disappoint us service is great love the environment. Servers always check up on you to make sure everything is good. All the food here is awesome I will continue to come here rain or shine

cKrEDNYvrQEaoJd7tU9yAA.text: I've only been to Tofu Hut and Mother's Korean Grill for Korean bbq here in Vegas and let me just say, Hwaro definitely beats both of these thus far. Heard about this new place from my cousin and was excited to try it out. My first impression of this place was that it had a more modern and rustic setting compared to any other Korean bbq place I've been too. Plus, the environment was very clean, especially in comparison to Tofu Hut. As for the food, there aren't too many choices but there is definitely a vast amount and variety of appetizers/tapas served with the food - my favorite part about this place. They had not only kimchi and bean sprouts, but also fish cakes, squash, pickled jalapenos and celery, and a ton more. The quality of the food is definitely up there. As for the service, it was overall pretty good. Even though the place got a bit busy and service began slowing down in pace due to this, servers still managed to take care of us and attend to our needs with a smile and positive attitude. Lastly, everything is pretty affordable - the average price you would expect to pay for AYCE Korean BBQ. Overall, great experience. I will most definitely be back.

6DvOeMCUjjMRl0HgXgukvg.text: This place is a bargain for 20 dollars. All the meats were good and the waiters kept up with refills and asking us when we needed anything else. The only hassle might be the parking situation, which would likely be worse during dinner times.

eOcNDXlPfOlKTk41pHGQQw.text: It's dirty,  the vents are horrible, and the meat is also nothing great. The only good thing I can probably say about this place is that the server was very considerate and nice.

vxVWMPTrNEHBS6jyzs1cyQ.text: Great food every single time! Me and my co workers come to eat here late at night twice a week and service is always amazing!

EVz1anjPzDhu_TpkKsUP5A.text: I've been in Las Vegas for nine years, and I believe this is now the fourth or fifth restaurant to be in the same location.  My most recent visit on September 27th left much to be desired.  A friend and I ordered Sundubu and were seriously disappointed.  Being Korean, it's hard to get too excited when eating out at a Korean restaurant, but the Sundubu here was awful.  All it had was tofu, water and some chili, which means there was absolutely no taste.  Making matters worse was the fact that the banchan had no taste, including the Kimchi! I'm not sure how you manage to screw up Kimchi, but this place did it.  It was also a disappointment to find out that they did not have their liquor license, so the normal Soju and Hite Beer were also absent, along with any taste that should have accompanied our meal.  I'll stick with Honey Pig, E-Jo or Sura.

6X26Ui92VO0oF05Yo0rD3w.text: my favorite place for ayce bbq! the meat is amongst the best out of all the bbq joints nearby and their service is always good! the wait isnt too bad and you will always leave satisfied. if you want ayce bbq, this is the place!

0k01qcNpYoyaemGas3_eQA.text: Hwaro is not worth being called korean restaurant.hey... yelpers. Let me tell you something and wanna disclose a fact. Go check this out at night  back side of the kictchen of the restaurant. You can realize creepy family group of rats and roaches travel around to enjoy their feast. Sooooooo scary and yucky....  what do inspectors check about when they come ? Yelpers ! You guys can a photo of a dead roach on logs of photos customers uploaded on main page of yelp. Ji0yCzu-_dUt-Gb01ETS5w.text: Great food! Great price!...good service! I will keep coming back here whenever my cravings for the AYCE KBBQ demand for it!

9o2IU774r6EU9x9DZ4lJjA.text: Went there a couple nights ago, heard that this was a new korean BBQ place we had to try it out. When we got there, there was barely any wait and there was 2 of us. Sat down at the large table cause they're were no smaller ones which was fine. We drank the tea water and it was okay for what's suppose to be like an iced tea it was very watered down so I was a bit disappointed in that and I didn't like the fact that they charged us for it when most places don't. Appetizers were good, loved the salad. When we ordered the first bunch of meat they gave us a platter of everything we order but in kind of small portions and when we reordered something they gave us a lot of that one order. So it didn't make sense to me to give us little of everything then give us a lot later. Everything on the grill looked great, even the pork belly was thicker than what I've usually have seen which didn't really bother me because it was good but all the meats they gave us were chewy. Tasted good but really chewy. They open till late at night so that's a plus but it wouldn't be my first Korean BBQ choice.

ffS1XkhcFYm5nCwm7lWNuQ.text: Delicious! I had no idea what to expect and it was definitely a learning experience but so great! -1 star for the wait - 1 hr but it was on Memorial Day.

BHnGeoBQaIIz8SVlQux8FA.text: Came in after seeing the yelp reviews, I'm from out of town and definitely go to KBBQ in my area quite a bit so when I came here I wasn't expecting anything out of the ordinary, but omg It was amazing and the menus was plentiful more than the average KBBQ in my area. I would definitely recommend this place and will be coming back on my next visit to LV the service and food were amazing!

OecORosP9vRS5M_W2v4GMg.text: First time going to Korean bbq and I loved it. My little sister introduced me to this little gem. The food was amazing and service was great. Felt comfortable and this place is definitely a favorite. Worth every penny.

ZvA_ra1n_qAZEvL8V9eIng.text: Great place good quality love the staff !! They only do walk ins and its busy all day so make sure u come prepared to wait but most of the time they seat u earlier than the quite time they give u will come back again !!!

0yteXfqbNuDpMkVyK904wg.text: Hwaro is good, but it's not amazing. The seating is very limited due to the space being small, and it's really hard to find parking because it's always busy at night. The service and food is great every time you go, but nothing is eye-catching. I'll always come here though!

xK-8d_K4ctQJ_318Iawc-Q.text: This is the best Korean BBQ in Vegas all you can eat and comes with dessert. You can also have rice and salad and the salad is really good definitely balances out the meat flavors.

PPLKZK5bdd_2qI9s1J1Adw.text: Came here again after a while, and Gina provided amazing service. Everyone is attentive to our table for orders, grill change, etc. I love this place and always recommend it when my friends crave kbbq!

uCx8QVZOX0XHVriDDiAWyw.text: Best Korean bbq in town, other than the wait, which can be a bit lengthy, but when you're that good it should be expected. Not only is their food fresh, but the service is superb, always very attentive where water and the grill are replaced without needing to ask.

hWIl7B76_GDt2xbRYTC9Iw.text: AYCE Korean BBQ at it's finest.  This is not my first meat rodeo. As a long time KBBQ fanatic I think I've settled on the best place to satisfy the insatiable urge for bulgogi. I had the pleasure of being taken to flavor town by the wonderful Joey. Not only was Joey's service polite and fantastic, I left in a better mood (Not just because I was hangry).  To sum up the atmosphere of Hwaro; the seating arrangement makes the place feel airy and open, it does not feel crowded even when all the tables are taken.   From the relaxed music to the wood covered accents adorning the entire restaurant, Hwaro feels natural and puts you in a trance while you taste the sweet meaty flavors of the orient.  Hwaro is hands down a must eat. The experience is one that is sure not to disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Ambiance of Hwaro

QE3Ok4kRGBkbcZ4JIIjmIA.text: This place is lit af  food is bomb af too, were def gonna go back here and chill   Beef brisket! Baby octopus! Corn cheese! Bulgogi nacho! Kfc (korean fried chicken) and don't forget about the gyozaaaaas!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

gC80r1SMUsOurCYfNMxpaQ.text: Pretty good place to have yakiniku Korean bbq for the price to go all you can eat. Just get there early because the line can get busy real quick and the line gets long.

48qS_OlJGACiCFVoOxOqHg.text: Always go to KBBQ restaurant in Las Vegas. Great place to eat with friends.

5wwpB5jT8cVDVowY7Q5s0w.text: I was super impressed by all the banchan that covered table. I was excited to finally get to try rice paper with my kbbq and their kimchi is the best I've had from a restaurant!  The menu is massive so you will not have a hard time finding food to fill your cravings. I wish I had more room in my belly to try everything! My favorites were the brisket, beef belly, squid and cheese corn. Mmm the cheese corn here is really garlicky and sweet.   Definitely try the yogurt soju! I don't think ours was mixed properly so the first shot tasted like plain soju. But the next rounds were so tasty! Like an adult version of those tiny yogurt drinks we drank as kids.   The service was super slow. There were many empty tables when my group of four got there, but we still had to wait 20 min to be seated. We had to flag our waiter down every time we wanted to order more meat, and we had to ask twice for a refill on our water and salad.   However, for the authenticity and cheap price, I do not mind having bad service. I will still be back for more and you bet this will be my go to place to take all my friends who visit me in town!

baVVN5NdvMws2aMbSyPbqg.text: This is my favorite kbbq place ever. The price are not very expensive and the meat are fresh. It would be much better if you guys would have more desert to choose from and I'll come back next time .

FH0vfb7Gux3o55hUuebkxw.text: A bit cramped inside. Portions seemed a bit small compared to some other places in town.  Wasn't sure if the waitress understood what please bring two servings of this or that etc.. meant as one serving wasn't big enough for three people. Or if there was a policy we weren't informed. Also a bit concerned by the painting hanging on what looks like a fire exit near the bathrooms. Will not be returning or recommending

qWs5qapfreKKc3XiSDTT9w.text: I don't know why this restaurant charge gratuity for 4 people? And don't tell customer ,I wrote tips double times?

VyoV9OeGFDfVL684OYXZLg.text: Went here on Monday night. There is a little wait before I sat. Woww.. on Monday night.  This place is awesome. The price is very reasonable  and the choice of meat is fabulous. They have plenty. You can order half if you think you want to try a new thing and in case you don't like it. I love their octopus and skirt steak. The rib eye and short rib is ok tho. Can't complain with the price that I pay.   Service just fine. I think it's run in any Korean restaurant. Only at magal and hobak you will get a good service. well i guess it because they have a la carte, not AYCE.  The server not even tell me what kind of meat that they bring it over, if they don't want to explained it to all customer that's fine, but at least ask whether or not we want to know. The meat plate that he brought, he kind of threw it at the side of the table. So rude!!   Come back? Maybe. I just hope that I'm not get serve by that rude waiter again.

EYPeAxv4R9cQhtClfAunDQ.text: I love this place. I love the food. I love the sides and I love the servers. Except for tonight there was this one rude Asian guy in red and I was taken aback because they usually have great service here. And also IT IS SO HOT IN HERE!!! There is something wrong with their ventilation system because I'm sweating beads as I write this review. I won't be coming back until they fix this issue because it is very uncomfortable to eat in a restaurant and sweat like it's 100 degrees. Please fix asap.

uxph4SFyS01pZfs8ntH_8Q.text: Hwaro... what can I say? The portions are huge and I suggest that if you're doing all you can eat, start slow. I came here for my birthday with a table of 8. Great selection of meats. My friend made reservations and once we got there via Uber, we still waited outside of the restaurant for a good 10 minutes. But that was okay. (We weren't in a rush) There were so many people outside. I would say 25 people outside of the restaurant waiting to get in. This was my first time eating here and I didn't mind waiting and catching up with friends.   The waiters and staff are very nice. They came to check up on us, brought us more side dishes when we were done and cleaned our stove pot frequently. However, they didn't refill our waters consistently.   This place is next to King Fu Tea (my favorite boba place) so if you do plan on eating at Hwaro and want to get boba after, save your appetite and room for dessert.

nM69nCoy9X6W8xiWzO8b0g.text: They have a great selection of KBBQ and always so good. :) Definitely recommend. They have the usual, bulgogi, brisket, pork belly, chicken, and so much more lol. I swear I find new stuff everytime I come here. Try 'the shit' for the appetizer, and the affogato for dessert. This place is a must!

gqTPg2FBRWIwe6MTCZX6yQ.text: Best Korean BBQ in Vegas! The All-You-Can-Eat price is amazing & the service is always great. I go here all the time & I refuse to try another Korean BBQ place other than Hwaro. For appetizers you must try "The Shit", it's literally called "The Shit". I'm not making it up, and like they tell you, you must try. I also get the KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) & the Bulgogi Nachos, best nachos I've had and it's just an appetizer! They have so many options when it comes to meats. I get the Beef Flank, Hwaro Spicy Pork, Sliced Rib Eye, and Spicy Chicken. I've also had Cajun Chicken, but I like a little more kick to my food, so I prefer the Spicy Chicken. The staff is always so nice and multiple staff members will check up on you whether it's there table or not. Tip: I like a lot of refills when I eat food, but with Hwaro, if you want soda, it's in a can. So, I don't drink my soda until my food is cooked that way I don't have to keep refilling it. They give you a pitcher of water, so stick with that until you're food is done unless you want to pay more for another can. Two cans do the trick for me.

YJRCosmmxXjqR_2JDr3B5A.text: Walked in and was greeted right away. They set up our table and called us to sit right away after, which is very good and accommodating. The servers Jenna and Baek attended to us right away with drinks once we got seated down and took our order. Very fast and efficient service. Everything was delicious, from the meats to the appetizers to the side dishes. They have green tea pork belly! I'm a big fan of anything with green tea. They also have pork cheek and pork skin. I haven't eaten in a Korean bbq place with any pork skin or pork cheek before so this is a first time for me. I like their selection of meats. Will be back!

HC9M9QkLoqnvPa_NnORN7A.text: I have tried different korean restaurant and I thought they were the best but when I knew this place. The WORD BEST isn't enough for this place. The #1 Korean bbq! Good service and very relaxing ambiance. Will surely be back. Even my 20 months old baby boy likes the food and place. Definitely deserves a five star for this restaurant.

Ho0-ODOf2WIrwYwSuU-UIg.text: I love this place!! 5 star!! Customer service is awesome and the food is great! Wish I can say more but this place never disappoints me. Get the baby octopus because it's really good.

xfh29DjQUH8eLB6FPPjZwQ.text: This GEM of a restaurant is inside a small little shopping plaza right in China Town.  Hwaro is pretty small, and has limited seating, which means sometimes the wait for a table can be somewhat lengthy at times.  However, the wait is completely and utterly worth it!  For a set "all you can eat" price, you can order as many meats, side dishes, and appetizers as your heart desires!  The servers and bussers are all very friendly, attentive, and so speedy!  Just about anything we ordered came out within seconds after the server walked away from the table.  The food itself was all very fresh and had great flavors. Especially all of the Kimchi and Kimchi vegetables!  This is definitely one of my favorite Korean BBQ spots here in Vegas, and I'm sure you'll feel the same!

NP-7GCUkI4Pal0Xf6Q-afA.text: This is probably one of the best kbbqs in town !!!! I'm sure you've heard about it. For the price and selection, this restaurant is memorable for sure. A tower of beer, The SHIT, Green tea Smoked Pork Belly, and Hwaro Premium Steak were my favorite portions of the meal. The wait time can extend quite long, but going in the morning near 11:30 secured me a 15 minute wait. The staff was extremely quick and attentive to my table, and made the experience pleasant and fluid. Can't wait to return; staff, keep doing what you're doing!

wAuZVfG2Kznnbqeg-6Maug.text: What an amazing experience this was. With so many AYCE KBBQ options it can be hard to figure out which one to try. Let me help you with that decision, go to Hwaro! My cousin and I went for an early dinner and it was an amazing experience.   Service was so great there and they were very prompt with bringing anything we needed. I find this really important when doing AYCE because you want to maximize your food intake. Lol. We ordered pork belly, sirloin, ribeye, and ribs. Each thing was amazing! The pork belly is a go to for me at these places. The sirloin was a surprise and ended up being super tender and cooked wonderfully. The ribeye is a trusty go to as well and the ribs were seasoned well and also delicious. This place gets Busy fast, so come early. But it's definitely worth it!

CHO8z_-G1clRNx-BxphCBA.text: Boy were we lucky. An impromptu conversation with our uber driver as we drove through Vegas Chinatown had him pointing out this place as his favorite Korean and a must since it was only a 5 minute walk along Spring Valley from the Chinese Foot Spa to which we were headed. The menu is really simple. $24 for the AYCE lunch, and then a few extra dollars for access to the premium cuts of meet too. Honestly, since there were easily 20 meats that came with the basic lunch, it didn't make sense to spend more money, especially as bulgogi was part of the standard lunch. In addition, you get access to 2 dozen or so appetizers and salads, and Korean Banchans to your hearts content of course. My personal favorite was the squid of all the meats, while BF went for his class bulgogi. If we didn't have a show to rush to we would have probably stayed longer at this place. As it was, we arrived at 2pm and still faced a small wait. Service is friendly and fun. The K-Pop music in background is a better mix than I've heard at other Korean places.  This place is cute beyond words. Korean meets industrial meets zen. There's a fake cherry blossom that is incorporated into the decor. Hard to describe pretty cool.  Obviously we had an uber pick us up, but the lot is space as its part of a shopping plaza.

I7_QtN_MyD9jk_h302UfQQ.text: Poor quality of meat.... Even for a AYCE BBQ Smelly... having a rock in the rice is just unacceptable. Willing to speak to the owner how there quality of meat compared to other AYCE bbq places is horrible...  No star for here. THe server however was very polite and kind! Only she deserves a star

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. I was fed up with the low quality of the meat but having a rock in the rice... I am just losing my mind.

bLjyg_RvOEMc9652NGvlgg.text: I came here with 4 friends and this place is sub par in terms of meat quality and service. Towards the end of our stay it really seemed like the staff just wanted to rush us out. They even gave us mismatched affagato's with some with no coffee and others with just a little. I get if there is a time limit but it came off as unprofessional to me. Not that they care but I wont be coming back ever.

H-BhJzFhG161IpLtNeGVcg.text: I really like Hwaro for many reasons, I have some small things I didn't like. This plaza gets pretty busy because the ramen place next door is really popular as well. carpool if you can.   Pros:  You can get all your basic meats for a cheap price during Lunch and Late night ($20) all 7 days of the week. IF you want the more "premium meats" like beef tongue and short ribs, you can pay the All day Special price (but everyone must choose the same option).  -They have ice cream options- green tea/vanilla, and you can also get an affogato (vanilla ice cream and coffee) which is a nice pick me up after eating all that food.  -You can order cheese fondu and cheese corn! You cook it in an aluminum cup on the grill and let the cheese melt.  -I mixed meat into my cheese corn and it was awesome. It's actually something they do in Korea too! :)  -Pickled Radish Wraps- my favorite way to have Brisket is with these wraps that are sweet/sour, add a nice crunch, and is a healthy alternative to rice paper -Salad- Dressing is light and tasty. I add it to my pickled radish wrap and I make a little Korean taco that's free of "carbs".  -Service was pretty good. Staff came to check on us regularly. It's smaller than I expected -I actually liked all the meat I tried from their basic lunch menu:  Brisket (never fails to disappoint), Prime Rib Bulgogi (the first batch was awesome, the second batch was huge and less fatty so more tough. It was also less flavorful), hwaro spicy pork, and green tea pork belly. I don't like to eat too much pork though. I'm one of those weirdos who cuts off the fat of my pork belly and some of my meat... (don't judge me, my arteries thank me everyday) :)   You have to request sesame oil-salt-pepper for a sauce dip. That's typically used for dipping pork into. Not a lot of people use this, so I understand why it's not standard. They give you a small squeeze bottle of brisket sauce. :)  They have a wide array of korean beers and soju.  I did not try the Hwaro spicy rice or the Hwaro noodles. Those come in large servings and are definitely shareable. The rice is basically like a bibimbap bowl which is AWESOME. I didn't realize until I finished eating that it was pictured on the menu. The spicy noodle also looks fancy. Didn't personally get to try it but I think they also have gochujang in it for the "spicy" kick.   Cons:  -Some tables do NOT have a vent. This could be illegal. I personally was sat at one of these tables and ended up coughing a lot afterwards because I have asthma and inhaling smoke usually triggers it. -Their side dishes were not very good. The kimchi was probably the best, but the fish cakes smelled and tasted weird to me. The pickled cucumbers could be a little sweeter in my opinion. I think it was sweet mashed potatoes, but the white mashed thing was a bit too interesting for me to understand. (BUT THIS IS NOT A BIG DEAL. i DON'T NEED SIDE DISHES TO BE HAPPY - except I really like spicy pickled radish.... I wish they had that haha) -Steamed Egg was super bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. &#34;The Sh*t&#34;-deep fried spicy mayo+crab
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Your first order will be presented on an oddly nice board
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Side dishes, small circular grill (*some grills dont have a vent over them, i was coughing a bit afterwards)

ey8WjR-ASjNusK-XTI35Eg.text: Our family are huge fans of Hwaro...this is probably our favorite ayce kbbq in Vegas.  They offer a good selection of items in their menu.  Now I'm not only talking about the bbq itself but their appetizers and sides.  Personally, I'm a big fan of the already cooked foods (I'm definitely a minority in my family) and they have so much to choose from.  From their shake shake rice, the shit, steamed egg, kfc, etc.  Oh and they have both my radish and rice paper (Hwaro ftw)!  The other ayce kbbqs I've been to, either has one or the other or neither.  You can almost always expect there to be a wait to be seated. Each and every time we've been here, there is always people waiting outside to be seated. So just take that into account when coming here. What's cool though is that they text you approximately when your table should be ready and when its ready.  No need to stay close and wait for the host to call out your name. I thought that was pretty convenient. Especially during those hot summer Vegas days when it's just way too hot to be waiting outside to be called. I would much rather wait in my ac cooled car.  Also it doesn't matter whether it's late at night or during the day, there's a wait. But if you come late night (I believe after 10pm), they offer late night pricing at $19.95. They do offer less than the all day menu but still a win when it comes to kbbq.

KddAi1q7QT_q8QIwRK0sNA.text: This place is legit. Off the strip. And not Gen. good service by Jehsica who always came by with a great smile    Food quality and portions were excellent. No wait on a weekday at 7pm!   We will definitely be back. Oh and check in via Yelp for a $0.01 beer   #BeefLife

ZwTUJB-62Kq_U0Fl3luriA.text: What a find! It's off the strip but worth the Uber ride. Great K-BBQ selection, fun music, hip decor. I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

-cQfnk7cdECV86cr-bluJA.text: I looooove Hwaro!   I'm not sure why I havent checked-in on Yelp here before, but I've been to Hwaro so many times for the past 3 years! It is definately my go-to place for fair priced AYCE Korean BBQ. Since my first visit here, this place has definitely gotten a lot popular! The waits have been a lot longer especially during the weekends for dinner. They do not take reservations so plan on waiting for sometime! This place is definately great for groups as they have a couple of longer tables where large groups can sit. Otherwise, most of the seating is comfortable enough for 4 tops.   BE FORWARNED. Think about it: it's summer in Vegas and you're essentially grilling indoors. It's about to be hot in this b*tch! So dress comfortably during the summer time. ...or it just might be the AC wasn't working as well the day we came. Also, if you don't plan on going home/hotel after to shower, you're going to smell like BBQ the rest of the day. Imagine smelling like BBQ and being hot and sweaty in Vegas. Not comfortable!  My husband and I love their sides. The kimchi is good here! I love the potato salad. We ALWAYS order beef tongue, brisket, chicken and beef bulgogi, THE SHIT, steamed egg, gyoza, kalbi. I recently tried the fish salad, which is sashimi with spicy (but not spicy) mayo. Of course, it was really good.  The service here is fair. I mean, I don't really care for cheery-outgoing servers when it comes to AYCE as long as you can get the food from the kitchen to our table ASAP. Our most recent visit was kinda slow for some reason.  Will be coming back as always!

2ueSkYLflo3VKA8VddroXw.text: First time coming to a Korean BBQ joint closest to the West Coast and it did not disappoint. I guess it is True that Asian foods is better and cheaper in the West.   The choices of meats and appetizers were endless which it could easily cost $28 per person back home in the East Coast. All the meats we tried were not too fatty, very fresh and tasteful. Their Hwaro Premium steak was a surprised our party since we received a big slab of ribeye!! I like how the buffet includes dessert but too bad it is only one order per guest. Also, their banchan was yummy especially their kimchi. Though watch out for the seafood salad (mixed/diced raw fish) if you have a soft stomach; it arrived room temperature though raw fish should arrive to our table cold.      Minus 1 star for their service. A few employees in their were not friendly looking. Seems like they are carrying an attitude. I feel like the restaurant is small so they do not really have a main waiter/waitress. One of the waiter was outstanding though. Also, they do not cook the meats on the grill for you-- you have to do it on your own. I am not sure if this is a West Coast thing or they do help you out but our table did not get that treatment. At least, the estimated waiting time I was told for my table was on point! I would definitely come back to this place.
