sqoPjZ_GQN5AfaJAiGQgWg.text: As tourists to Las Vegas and avid fans of Korean BBQ, we were recommended Hwaro by a local. We are so so glad that we went.  We are from Texas and have had our fair share of Korean BBQ, and this is some of the best we've had. The meat is very juicy and cut thick, you have a wide variety of sides which are all very delicious. The all you can eat meal and price is a STEAL compared to ours back home. You get as much as you want of any side and meat and there's so many more choices to choose from.  The vibe of the restaurant is very nice. The music is great, the atmosphere is friendly. It's a relatively small restaurant, which is great because that means that it's not hard for a server to tell when you need anything and provide great service. That leads me to the best part of our whole experience--the service. We were so incredibly lucky to be sat with Tyler. He was very attentive to anything we needed and made great recommendations to us whether it was food or drinks! We hardly had to ask for anything because before we could even think to ask, he was already on top of it and getting it for us. Everyone else who helped us was nice too, but Tyler was our main server and he was AMAZING! I would go back again for the amazing service alone (okay, fine, for the delicious food... but the service is still incredible). If you come here, ask for Tyler! You definitely won't regret it.  Thank you, Hwaro and Tyler, for some of the best food and customer service that I have ever had. This was our first time coming to Hwaro, but after the great experience we had we know that it won't be our last. This is a new go-to place every time we come back to Las Vegas. :-)

X1VYzxyK82fUkfBCEZO4EA.text: The best comparison is a more neighborly version of Gen Korean BBQ minus the neon lights and K-pop music.  You will get good friendly and prompt service but wished that the crowds would go away as a 30 minute wait is typical.  The biggest plus is that AYCE is only $22.99 per person.  The meats and sides are standard.  Unfortunately, the "premium" steak which is limited to one person is pretty tough same as Gen.  However, for this price, you can't really go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. More meat
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Meat festival

T3JWVEVwuWRfCzdmnyw8Lw.text: My favorite kbbq place in Vegas. Has tons of meats with a lot of appetizer options. Pretty packed most of the time but for a good reason. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to try kbbq for the first time or are in town and want some good kbbq.

oiFUpNf-ViGnTF24bhClGQ.text: This is by far the best Korean BBQ place in my opinion. The staff is friendly and attentive, the place is clean and ample. The price is reasonable. Nothing to complain about here. Highly recommended.

gQraXrS9Qk1FidaZEG9j3g.text: Korean vibe is strong!  Our favorite all you can eat Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas. Located in Seoul Plaza (where you can find Raku, Sweets Raku, Monta Ramen, and Trattoria Nakamura-Ya).   We liked everything that we've tried from the menu.  Been here a few times and we always receive excellent service from their staff. Especially this girl named Janice... Seriously! This girl does not slow down. She was working all the tables the last time we were there.   Must get: Brisket, Beef bulgogi, Green Mussel, Premium Steak (1 order per person), Enoki Beef (1 order per person), Korean Fried Chicken, The Shit, and Shake Shake Rice.   Writing this review is making me crave for "the shit". Probably heading there for dinner tonight.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

0TYfFa7IPIa2Kf8U4jqrAQ.text: Great customer service! And great quality meats! Lunch and late night special goes from 1130a-4p and 10p-3a and it's only $19.95! Def our go to spot for kbbq!

tnH9WXkOIS4niImVn-GrXQ.text: Always good quality food and nice service, the price is reasonable you can choose all kinds of meat options and sides.

JQbvP8hutEzxHkC4Hm9lcA.text: By far the best Korean BBQ we have ever had. Our server, Cindy, was awesome and make great recommendations for us. One of the items called "THE SHIT" was the SHIT...AWESOME. FROM THE PRIME RIB TO THE SPICY PORK EVERYTHING WAS AWESOME. Anybody looking for a Korean BBQ in Las Vegas this would be the place to go.

hVZarxp6xbMF3BkGwKIfJQ.text: My favorite kbbq in Vegas!! Everything about this place is great- the atmosphere, price, quality, service!   For price they have an all day pricing for around $25, and late night/lunch pricing is only ~$20! These are such low prices compared to some of the kbbq places where I'm from!  They also have unique dishes like "The Shit" and "Hwaro Rice" (they're marked with must try) and this is sooo True because these dishes are sooo amazing!  The service is awesome too, they came by to change our grills and take our orders in a fast and kind manner. The inside is gorgeous too-I love the intimate look!  They have a really good dessert called affogato ice cream, which is like a sweet coffee ice cream. They also have other options of ice cream for dessert as well.   For the meats, I love the quality of all of them. I especially like tripe and pork belly, but they have soo many options. It's all definitely worth a try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Hwaro rice
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Yum!!
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Nachos!

qEmgCB-S_1e0CCfuS0m20Q.text: Great experience! This is a meat lovers paradise. Our server was efficient yet very flat in emotion...no syrupy kindness from her!  Very attentive service. So much fun grilling our own food! We both loved the marinated beef cuts the best. Delicious kimchi. Spicy! Such a great cough inducing spice level for most of our sides and meats.   Everything was too spicy for the kiddos but I just plied them with the "all you can eat ice cream" trick so the parental units could gorge in peace. Dang, I swear our 6 year old ate 6 cups of ice cream!   I highly recommend the affogato- vanilla ice cream with coffee and crunchy toppings (looked like honey bunches of oats cereal). Best meal in Vegas for this trip!

KIFx7mdbLw9NM0vH5nxAjA.text: First meal of my 4 day weekend from California hustle & bustle (LABOR DAY - 8/30/19). We decided to try this place based off Yelp reviews. My friends who were also from out of town wanted to try this place.  We decided to go for lunch. The restaurant is located in a small plaza with other restaurants that share the parking area. The outside doesn't look appealing but it looks like this area can get really busy. Luckily we came during opening hours cause there was still ample parking (plus it was 1130am in 100 degree weather).  When we walked in, it was as expected from the Yelp photos. Clean and nice. Earthy decor and a big sakura tree was displayed in the middle of the dining area. That tree is great for photos, just a tip.  Our party chose to do the Lunch menu at $20, 44 items to choose from plus one dessert. They did have another option of an ALL DAY price of $23 with any additional 10 items.   We ordered pork belly, beef belly, brisket for our first round. They had two different dipping sauces, a premade salt/pepper/sesame oil & a sweet and salty sauce, but it was not teriyaki. It was different, but I liked it. We enjoyed the banchan while waiting for our meat. I love how every AYCE I've been to offers different types of banchan. The banchan included salad, kimchee, rice paper, radish paper, fish cake, cucumber kimchee with enoki mushrooms, and pickled onions. You can also order appetizers to share. We tried "The Shit" which was bomb. You have to try it. We tried the friend tofu (too dry), KFC Korean fried chicken which was like a chicken nugget, it was good.   The cuts of pork belly were thick and juicy. The beef belly was different than what I'm used to. It had more meat than fat, but it was still good. The brisket was the same as other places I've gone to. We tried the prime steak and green tea pork belly. The prime steak was tender and the pork belly had hints of green tea, not overwhelming.   After dinner we all enjoyed a scoop of ice cream. A few if us had green tea and the other have affogato (vanilla ice cream with coffee).  Overall the experience was great. I'm glad we tried this place with friends. The service was great. Attentive, friendly and efficient. The servers always checked up on us and refilled our water often. If you're even in town and want an AYCE KBBQ, stop by here cause not all KBBQ is AYCE.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Affogato dessert
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Love the Asian Decor

1H9N5cxeR355xjP5nAt_vQ.text: With the many dinning options in Vegas, we ended up here for dinner. Waits can be long if you come during dinner rush. We waited between 45 mins to 1 hr. When we finally got seated, a few banchans were readily available. Menu is all you can eat. With dinner being 23.95 and lunch being 19.95. They have a wide variety of meats. Our go to is short rib, brisket, and tongue. Meats were good and the ones they were marinated; were seasoned well. I loved the green onions and sprouts side dish. Many other Korean bbq places don't have this. So this made me super happy. It also came in a huge bowl. It's a great pairing with the meat. Most of the banchans were great. Except the fish cake was a little hard. Only ding there. My brother in law loves the seafood salad. It's basically poke over salad. Come early and give this place a try.

wtdCvEj7jlfpOO5ZJhowNw.text: Hwaro is basically my new happy warm place. But get there early and hungry. Good lord don't try to go on a Friday night either. Nope. Meats are excellent. Squid is delicious and my husband hated that whole process of me cooking and eating it but man was it seasoned amazingly. Really I don't want to review this place because it is so popular and by reviewing it I feel like more people will want to try it but I owe it to the people.  The only thing I was not crazy about was them not having leaf lettuce............ why YOU LOSE A STAR! Jk it's my own preference growing up but I understand everywhere is different. I'll just sneak in my own..... kidding... maybe..  My husband who is white didn't understand why we had to cook our own food but by the end of it decided it was pretty cool and galbi is his favorite! I've taught him well. We will be back Hwaro! But probably for lunch or early dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Yelpers!!

gusUB5-HWwgsnO7xF7WFcw.text: Came here not too long ago. Now this and Hae Jang Chon in SoCal are my favorite Korean bbq places!   FOOD 4/5: Quality of meat is really good. I liked the brisket, beef belly, and pork belly, but my absolute favorite was the skirt steak! It was really tender and that beef flavor is so clean and delicious. Their other steaks are also really great and definitely worth trying. I also loved how they have so many side options. Garlic butter, fondue, the shit, and gyoza were all great. But my personal favorites are the corn cheese and the hwaro rice!   SERVICE 5/5: Exceptional service. I came here first with some friends. Half our party came very late, but our waiter was very patient & accommodating and allowed us to be seated first. Never had any trouble trying to get a waiter's attention. In fact, it was quite the opposite. Our waiter was so friendly and so attentive - kept checking up on us super often.   ATMOSPHERE 4.5/5: Inside is so cute! They have this tree with pink flowers in the middle of the restaurant, it looks so pretty! Only thing is that I wish the AC was stronger, it was so warm that I was sweating.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

qWC_txYF3UqbXwvN1--hwA.text: This was my go to place until Master Kim came to town. It looks like they have up their game with better quality meat and a few new dishes. The wait was about 40 mins with a group of 6 around 7pm on a Sunday night, which is typical for a small establishment.   The good: - Brisket (most of the time, however, we did get cuts with a lot of fat in them towards the end). - Beef tongue  - Hwaro spicy rice is a must!!!  - Beef belly  - Skirt steak - Rice paper (some places don't have this) - Steam egg - open late for those late night cravings (until 3am) - 15% off for military or first responder (per person) - service is good  The bad: - Time limit is 1 hour and 20 mins (it bothered us that this is the one place that actually will give u a last call on ordering even when there is no group waiting) - 15% service charge for groups of 4 or more - Fish cake is normally good but this time was very hard and chewy - inconsistent number or orders ( ordering 3 brisket one round was more than an order of 5 brisket)  Overall, I would come here again considering their meat quality have improved and we can't get enough of that Hwaro spicy rice!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. AYCE RULES
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. The Shit

l9VdUQWlAa5zF7jNpKLKPQ.text: Korean BBQ is absolutely amazing! If you haven't had Hwaro's you must try it. It's absolutely amazing, but you are cooking the meat and seafood yourself so be prepared. If it's undercooked you have no one else to blame. The experience is really cool they bring you all the meat you order raw and you put it on the center grill in front of you. It's a cool interactive experience and the meat is all very different and so good. The spicy pork bulgogi and the short ribs are amazing!   A cool thing we found out is that my girlfriend and my favorite sushi spot, sushi Neko is the sister restaurant to hwaro. They are run by the same owner and closer to the east side Sakana is another sushi spot run but the same owner. Obviously, the owner knows what they are doing because they are all so delicious. They did change up a few things at hwaro's that we noticed, the grills look like they have been placed deeper in the table probably for safety reasons and the way the meat is presented is on a large plank board now, which looks great to the eye. They seem to have enforced the hour time limit a little more which is understandable because they are so busy! It's also helpful for me so I don't come out feeling like a bowling ball! They also began putting the desert in to go cups to get guests out quickly. It seems to be more efficient at least with our experience it did.   Awesome experience and just one more thing, our server came once to take our first order and then they all seemed to assist us, but that's all it took. David was very charming and very well spoken, he did a great job. Great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Sides that you begin with.

Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. All of the raw meats.

qO9TO3s8ooNNUb-S1gX-Ew.text: Brought some of my parents friends from japan here for dinner. This was our first time eating at Hwaro.   Prices are great for sure!  Around dinner time it got busy, and we definitely had to wait. The lady though tried her best to accommodate us as quick as possible.   As we sat, we were greeted.  Once we ordered and since we had a larger party, the quantity would be smaller. But everything came out right away!  Quality of the meat was ok, but usually kbbq places have side sauces, which I felt like was lacking here because the meat wasn't really marinated.  I didn't have any favorites except for the daikon papers to enjoy with the meat and the affogato for dessert.   Service was very attentive but got to the point at the end where she asked us if we needed anything else every 10-15 minutes which made me feel rushed to leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

4pAUjSxOTL5aUCTOBCWy2w.text: This isn't the best kbbq ever, but you definitely get your money worth here. It is AYCE and they have a variety of meats along with appetizers. Come for lunch when its only $20! We came right when it opened at 11:00 am and there was no wait. We were given a two hour limit, but that was still enough time for our group of 7. By the time we left, all the tables were full and there was a line waiting. Come early since this place gets packed.   We ordered most of the appetizers (tofu bean paste soup, gyoza, bulgogi nacho, seafood salad, sweet & spicy tofu, The Shit, steamed egg). I would recommend passing on most of them and just sticking to the meat. None of us really liked the shit, it's just a deep fried sushi roll. Also on the seafood salad (basically a tiny poke salad). But do definitely get the soup, steamed egg, and corn cheese to dip all your meats in, it just adds another layer of flavor. The rest are more filler dishes but it's nice to have those options if you're tired of eating so much meat.   The brisket and pork belly were the best cuts of meats. The green tea smoked pork belly is something I normally don't see on the menu and it turned out ok. It's nice being able to try so many things. My group was stuffed by the end. Everything came right away, service was good here.   Tip: Yelp check in gets you a free drink - get the peach flavored soju. Its delicious and comes in a cute pink can.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. The SHIT

BEz8fZsPc5Hxhmcaklvq6A.text: AYCE is not AYCE, When they limit your food. "You can have all the sides you want, but no more meat" What???? How is that all you can eat?  We paid full price and did not even come close to ordering a lot of meat.  We had a 7yr old child who still wanted more.   The A/C was working and it was hot a humid inside as well.   Too many options for this service. HWARO lost another Veteran and his extended family after this stunt.   You can be sure that every forum I belong to and every Veterans group will be advised to go elsewhere.  Our skinny 7yr old trying to fill up on ice cream (limited to 1) because they limited his meat.   Thank goodness there are 10 other places that treat you right and have working A/C.

YNpcISyuwsVSdksViJw9iw.text: I LOVE Kbbq! I'm originally from California and since moving to vegas I haven't found a Kbbq spot that truly hits the spot. I love eating things that most of my friends find questionable like intestines, and that was what lead me to Hwaro.   Here are some things that I really enjoyed at Hwaro: as soon as I walked in I was immediately pleased with the ambiance. I really like the outdoor/indoor vibe. The first thing you notice is the cherry blossom tree, and then the brick and cement accents making you feel like you're dining outside and it kinda also gives a street vibe. I also loved the entertainment. They had Kpop videos playing.   As far as food and service goes... the service was very quick, but I was quite disappointed that when I ordered intestines it never came and wasn't informed that they were sold out until towards the end of my meal (the main reason I'm giving 4 stars and not 5 considering I went to Hwaro solely because I was craving intestines and because it took me ordering it 3x for them to finally say they were out of it)... I was however very pleased with the fact they're the only place that offers rice paper. At the end of the day, I will be going back and hopefully this time I'll get all the intestines in the world hahaha.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Yummy in my tummy

AtUrQSDS-3ITN8t7aYYrVg.text: Went in with high expectations. Bad idea. It's good. It's not great. The sauce on the green onion salad is totally off. It doesnt taste anything like it should. ..??? KFC was decent. Very small portion and not the best, but it was good. . Bean paste soup hands down the best! Def get that with the rice!! Try putting the porkbelly in it. !!      .  Great service, ok quality meat. 80% korean flavors.

5ZDZw1522NrUUN8ZiGC7Mg.text: Came here during lunch time with some co-workers. This was my first time here and I absolutely enjoyed it! $19.99 for lunch time AYCE? You definitely can't beat that!  The items I loved were the brisket, enoki mushroom wrapped in meat, the steamed egg, seafood salad, & tongue. I'll be back for more!!!

zWypBKmozYFj-ydYARocMQ.text: First time here.  There was a bit of a wait. we were lucky enough to wait inside and not in the heat of the parking lot.  Our first choice was Mother's Korean but saw on Yelp that it had closed. We were sad.   Found Hwaro on Yelp with good reviews.  Good to go.  Had a little prob understanding the ordering.  The kids wanted to cook kalbi and pork belly and I wanted the ribeye steak.  I let my sister order and to my surprise, what she ordered was enough; sliced ribeye, pork belly, kalbi, baby octopus, calamari, chicken. Thankfully, the ribeye steak never made it to the table so I was able to cancel it. We were so full and had to roll out the door. We didn't smell like KBBQ which was nice. Definitely will try another restaurant in the AYCE family, next time we are in Vegas.

_iFsinThQXCnE8eAlyvLlg.text: Long wait but worth it. If coming with friends be careful the way that you order. I was new to this place and their menu is a little complicated. Let's say, to get a whole steak like a rib eye, you'll need about 6 orders. Sliced really thin, you feel like getting a lot but careful because when you start cooking is going to be a lot.   Would I come back? Yes. It's fun but way too much for kids.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Part of the items left over. I&#39;ll recommend order little by little. Don&#39;t order super hungry and you&#39;ll pay it later.

qRd4r5P6qYB_LZeO63ii3g.text: The staff is so friendly, we had a party of 15 people and even tho we were loud and asked for everything, not once did they seem annoyed! They were on top of their game!  The food was so delicious! I love how much variety they had. Such a cheap price for all you can eat! I definitely loved this place and will be coming back!

JfKJI1YbOhC17m7PGGe0ZA.text: This is our go-to yakiniku restaurant in Vegas! We just moved to north county San Diego, where there aren't that many Korean BBQ restaurants. I haven't actually tried any that are here so I'm not sure if they're legit or not but I was just assuming not.   Anyways, the AYCE is a deal! Each time we have driven to Vegas, we must eat here at least once!

QhmxH1X1ckmK8ikIlJYGlQ.text: My favorite KBBQ in town. Service is great, meat quality is great, sauce is great, and the best part for me is their options for appetizers.

78OKyzqczksxS7U0zX3ZVg.text: My husband and I are always on the hunt for different Korean BBQ spots, this one caught our eye last night. We arrived around 6:30pm, it was pretty crowded, but we were thankfully seated right away. The menu has plenty options, so we tried them all. Everything was DELICIOUS! Well seasoned/marinated. The green tea smoked pork belly was my favorite.   I really appreciated that the menu gave a list of the different side dishes (kim chee, radish wraps, potato salad, etc.) I went through a ton of radish wraps all by myself (my husband doesn't eat vegetables, lol) They paired perfectly with the different meats. The only thing I didn't see was japchae. Did I miss it?   If ever we're in the area again, we'll definitely be back. I was too full by the end of our meal to try the ice cream - I need the ice cream with coffee.

7OTFR7UjrLHQFbqcP7DiFQ.text: i have been here twice within the last several months. 1st time service was great. the young lady we had was friendly and always checking up on us, cleaning the grill, food was coming out pretty quickly. all while it was a weekend.   2nd time was ok. not as busy (on a monday night) and not much service. what also irratated me was the fact i ordered steamed egg and they had the nerve to serve me a burnt one. yes, it was dry and the bottom was black. i should have taken a pic of it but i like to stir my soup when i eat it. it tasted really awful but i still ate it incase they were to charge me extra. why would they even do that? If they knew it was smoking burnt just make a new one geez!  (-1 star) i had to wave at the workers sitting together at the first table by the door to get their attention. i hope i didnt ruin their conversation.  Other than that i like the place. but wish they would give more than 2 strips of pork belly        (-1star). and turn the vent on in there, it did get a little smokey in there.

K5nsU6aM1bEd4aQIL08QZw.text: I went here by myself to eat kbbq. Being new in town I don't have anybody to eat with. So I come in and I said I'm dining alone. He looked around and said, " you will have to wait". Ok fine. Then 15 mins later the waiter comes to me and said that they can't accept 1 person for the kbbq, but is offering me the 1 and only soup entree they have. Why let me wait to say they don't accept only 1 person, plus there's nothing in their restaurant that says so. Nothing that  says it has to be more than 1 person for the kbbq. This restaurant has excellent customer service to the max!!! I'm only giving 1 star coz I can't remove it already. But it is zero star!   I went to another kbbq  restaurant instead and it has an option for 1 person for the bbq. Expensive but worth it to satisfy the craving.

NOdWqSiHEyx2jHAraDaC2w.text: Best Korean BBQ in the valley, great choices of meat and appetizers , love their sauces, long wait but worth it!! A lot of people come here.

qbOpodm8cUx0bIxYssLx8A.text: I love this place...best all you can eat korean bbq place in all of vegas....service is great food is great the environment is overall great...kid friendly and best of all the price is best bank for ur buck...cant get that kind of food and service at that price...recommend this place to everyone...local and visiters

kI9Rg5R1Ni4CeITjqbTOlA.text: First time ever being here. So far everything is amazing . Waitress is very kind. Hot tea is wonderful! The place is very clean and the music they are playing is very calming! Recommend this place to everyone 5 starts all the way!

eU0c3LGzVGEh99eXlC7ywg.text: Bomb AYCE!'!!!! Late night specials and their banchan is awesome. I definitely recomend for AYCE either All day specials or lunch/late night.

CVWycJzJ8reF5DiS_fKXZg.text: Went here for the first time. Wait time was 30mins, which was fine since it was a weekend night. But they stuck us in a corner and forgot about us. We had to get up and roam around to find them so we can order more meat and refill the water. The basically forgot we were there. Also didn't get any tongs or scissors to cut and flip the food. So it stayed on the grill would almost burn.   Not worth your time and money! I will not be coming back.

tj2jvlEtGYTTDO6xyst3Fw.text: My girlfriend and I absolutely love eating here, the service is great, and the ambiance is even better! We love cooking our own food to our liking, and it's reasonably priced! I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys ayce fans out there!

OwaOlsbrD2bIDoNoMuvoKw.text: I eat a lot of Korean food in town and I thought this was an amazing place. Environment had a nice easy going energy. Food was outstanding and the service was great. Happy friendly staff. I will definitely be back here soon.

SnLklIz3FA63hyTWQMwdPQ.text: Probably not the best choice in the heat of summer, but none the less the food and service were great.  at $19.99 you can't beat the price for AYCE Korean BBQ.  The meat was fresh and well seasoned and the side dishes (my personal fave) were all authentic and fresh as well.  The server changed out our grill frequently and even dealt with our multiple requests to lower or higher the heat (we just couldn't get that perfect temp where the meat cooks evenly and charr's the outside).  While I don't claim to know much about Korean food, I feel like I can give this a great rating.

gOQiRmorYQp6Ai2ixhvjhw.text: What can I say. I could crawl up and live under one of these tables like a Korean BBQ troll, just in hopes of catching a mere morsel of that god damn sliced beef.

efuBOtsTo7BW8Fu92ff7fw.text: I must admit that the food was good, but the service was super bad. Most of the workers had attitudes which literally just made me lose my appetite. They were so slow and seemed so incomprehensible to whatever we asked to order. It took almost 4-6 times to repeat and "follow-up" on our orders, because they'd forget. Bad service.

3I-jKWLsb3MZgXivZHwYGQ.text: Not bad for the price you pay! 4 stars because the wait time. Also, there are about 4 or 5 tables that go to waste because they don't have vents over them.

6nWYYEmXAKYU-zImtLBvTg.text: love this place! service was great! every time i come here i leave satisfied :) woooooo!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

BD8F-CeoBSpNZE7f7ONkjQ.text: Great costumer service and food. The atmosphere is very friendly and inviting. There meat quality is good. Definitely recommend the beef tongue.

Ij4xpjeiYFsq5L_7ZiSNrQ.text: Guys I literally visit this place every week. Normally you would have a line if you came for dinner. Great food and great service, especially they updated menu recently.

zsPb6trpuLQmmwCq_rbjyw.text: Awesome experience with awesome service, love being able to come here and enjoy time with friends. The atmosphere is awesome, I would for sure recommend anybody and everybody to come.

6Jxq2Lpik5OXr9VabpXoBw.text: Great food but horrific customer service. We were constantly waiting for someone to come get us more water and we were sitting for 20 minutes before someone finally took our order. Every time we asked for something they would quickly walk away without letting us even finish what we were saying. We waited for everything way too long. Also their menu says they charge a 15% gratuity for over 4 people. OVER 4 people, but even though there was only 4 of us they charged us 15%. I would have paid that if the service was decent, but since it was terrible I fought for it and said that it does not say 4 or more. The associate said they didn't know that the menu said that. I don't understand how some of the associates don't understand the meaning of OVER 4. I'm usually a great tipper. Those who deserve it will definitely receive, but those who don't and are rude will not.

b-BgK-mth1sbvajm2KDykw.text: Great place for AYCE BBQ.  Good price, great meats, good side dish as well. Especially love green salad

Qygou3tr76qh2kq6KoBkcg.text: I love hwaro! Very enticing and love the vibe. The staff is always great and you MUST try some of that Shake Rice.

MSNab0JdqtOC-xcCiR8HEQ.text: We're not from here so we went just based on yelp reviews, it was 4 stars and we were tired of driving around... It's a AYCE place with no other Korean food except tofu soup. I got the tofu soup with side of galbi, it was very mediocre. My parents got the all you can eat meats-- bulgogi and spicy pork--they seemed to like that just okay. Minimal side dishes for lunch--none of the sticky rice wrap thingies, no lettuce wraps. They mischarged us so we had to fix that... Otherwise the service was fine. We've only eaten at this Korean establishment in Las Vegas so there's no other places to compare... Maybe for this town this place is fine to go, but I'll never go back.

TvxwqaGLvPvK3gSc_qvACg.text: Been here multiple times and always satisfied with the food! Absolutely love the KFC & Beef Flank. Highly recommended from a local!

aM8hoRfejjZ9d097hHHV-w.text: Amazing food, and great atmosphere!  I wish we had ditched the buffet on the strip the other night for this place!!

12QCzJ_2Ki_cYVpfeoQVxw.text: great food,i love this restaurant so muchbest choice is all you can eatSammy did the great service for us

sN0mCazyLGvijMixWYbVyQ.text: Everything about this place is EXCELLENT! Customer service, food and price! Best place for korean bbq with friends and family!! Highly recommended!

cfpVzFKRcdETffcpWj4Ilw.text: Such a great place to eat.. the price is fair, the service is great.. servers are attentive and fast.. we will surely comeback..

J7igN1A5yrlXDiPD_iPptw.text: Awesome place to eat been here a couple times.  Great side dishes and appetizers. And it's kid friendly

NB442FYGosiHgLNnYbIq5g.text: Great food, nice interior, great service by Sammy and affordable. I love the side dishes esp the appetizer egg thingy. Must try is the brisket so yummy and its sauce too. Bk7ZABqn8QMrBNPMWVG_nw.text: First time eating here and I heard it's worth the wait! I would recommend a group of people to go here and enjoy!

3_ABOi9DcfWAcxomgMaSuw.text: Place is clean and cool. Food is great and has a lot of selections. Has good customer service.

VYdXTAtHc2YpK_n1Z-Qgqw.text: I have never been to this place and this is my first time and the service is horrendous! We are a big group and they put us on their list. So we kept waiting and waiting. We were waiting inside almost an hour when all of a sudden the host  told us to go wait outside instead. There were people that got there after us that were waiting also, but for some reason we were the only once singled out to do so. We then asked how long til we get seated and the guy says we can only sit you on separate tables. Are you kidding me? They  pretended that they will accommodate us only to say that they really don't have a table for all of us because the long tables are reserved. Over the phone they said they don't take reservations. The staff were very rude and customer service is terrible. If they would have told us the minute we got there that they cannot accommodate us we would not have stood around for an hour for nothing. We will never go back to this place and I have no intention of trying the food either.

vRBSnpVFq71_OVJToGOAmw.text: The best Korean BBQ in town. The decor is what clean and inviting and the service is great. The selection of meats is incomparable and they had plenty of alcohol to choose from. The lunch is affordable, and the dinner is a steal $20. I would recommend

JGSI62eHjjr6NOYrGULyGA.text: great place for great food at a great value.  waiters are all very nice.  fast service.  two issues. first, the smoke panel up top.  part of it fell twice while dining and they dont really do anything about it.  secondly is the small lady thats in charge.  either owner or the manager.  rude.

t5IYHfNutrad7myHAryiiw.text: Hands down the best K bbq places in vegas. Great service, friendly staff and good portions per order. Only place I go to eat K bbq in town. Definitely recommend to eat here!

Te1cT23YbdDm0w9jBNyN7A.text: Hwaro is by far best Korean BBQ place to eat. I highly recommend it. Well priced great food and service.

WAC6_A6iLCC8Bekg6DkWYw.text: This place is ridiculous.  We came with our family to try it and they said it would be a two hour wait...but the place was 1/2 empty.  Lol.

Y5C6XhW2EqnBuENweF4uPQ.text: Brisket and bulgogi were the best in our opinion. This is another good korean bbq joint but not dramatically different or better than the others. On the negative side, they charged $10 for my 5 yr old kid who ate almost nothing. Also $1.50 for a can of coke? Should be free refills using a fountain machine. Lastly, I don't know why these korean places feel compelled to play top 40 music constantly. It's the same ubiquitous shite you hear everywhere. The sound of the fan wasn't enough to drown out the aural abomination.

IpZ6UUoR2ols7C1ZJ8gE9Q.text: This is our fourth time here and this place never fails us. Good service good food wonderful atmosphere!

LMcCZty08KZzroJDRdW_kg.text: So me and my party originally planned to eat at tofu hut. But ofcourse because of the long line, we decided to come over at hwaro instead which I found on yelp. And it being new, I told my friends we should try it out! As soon as we got there, we were seated right away. We opt for the 19.99 ayce. We ordered Baby octopus, pork skin, short ribs, sliced rib eye, brisket, and more!! Our server was very friendly, attentive and accomodating. Our experience was great and food is awesome, even the water. Im surprised their water is NOT tap water!! The meat were marinated perfectly. The pork skin and the sliced rib eye....ughhh i cant get enough of them. Will definitely come back!!  I knocked a star off because my cousin's chair was dirty when we got to the table so she had to exchange it herself with another chair from the table right  next to us...lol

Caj6zCfx3YPhjEbamaRD_A.text: Second time been here! It is super clean and  generous about the side dishes. It is 20.95 per person for all day special which is reasonable. I had Korean bbq in other places but this is my favorite! Must try!

kj0pqhj-ie_To91d4wt16Q.text: One of the coolest places I've eaten. Food is bomb. Atmosphere is cool. The concept of cooking your own food at your own table is hella cool. Plus the choices of sauces they give are pretty good. Definitely will come back

TLGa2VkU_OUHQZH4gfh6bQ.text: So let me just start off by saying that this is one of my favorite places to go in Vegas. For the quality of food and the price is very reasonable. I come here with my girls almost every week. Every time I come we have to wait about an hour which is pretty reasonable. Service is eh nothing special up to this point but I do see new faces. My server today, Gaeun, she was great! I came here with my best friends and she took care of us so well. It's so rare to find quality customer service but her service was top notch. As for food if you don't know what you think as her she will give you her honest opinion! Whoop Whoop! But food is great as usual I love their brisket and spicy pineapple beef steak! Only 20.95 per person and you get EVERYTHING on the menu. I most definitely will be hitting this place up again soon!

CSP6vuMH2NYfSmCZ-vOWTw.text: Came here on my best friends bday. Service is excellent and attentive even on a busy Thursday night

axI2UU4Cx4ubeFsP5bV9-g.text: Love the food and atmosphere! I will most definitely come back to this place if I'm in Vegas!

IpqujB8uOG8RhyOpiwr85g.text: Great place to get your KBBQ on. Great food, cool vibe, great customer service! Great great great great place!

NEh4toB2tKkwdaVdQg4Ynw.text: One of the best KBBQ in town. Try their "red wine pork belly", the meat was melting in my mouth

K6EE456ljAyIBGSnNhclKQ.text: I admire the location and environment of the place. Really impressed with the selection of meats and KPOP they play. Great place to take the kids to. Cheap and worth it.

mrNejVbHPS3N7lx4_c3f3g.text: Good service and yummy!!! Thank you a Asia boy waiter (As don't know where he come from but he speak very good English) Recommend this Korean BBQ~

bz5HQdeNiSGcz-lX8FyEFw.text: Yummmm! Recommended by a local, we're so glad we came too. We love Korean BBQ, and the all you can eat daily special is perfect to try a variety of meats. The staff was friendly and the environment was comfortable. Hope to come back the next time we're in Las Vegas!

VMX4zbXZ6O-6QlrboLsfbQ.text: So Korean BBQ is new on my list of foods I have been trying and this place is definitely on my list! Fresh cuts and excellent taste. The wait can been a little bit long but to my surprise it was well worth it. I'll be coming back for more!

NeS0rVxsIGcQkr5y_R7Ivg.text: Great bbq for the ayce price. Their premium steak, sliced ribeye, spicy pork bulgogi were very good. The bone in short ribs were somewhat chewy but still flavorful. "The shit" and shake shake rice were a must try as well!

YMhc7n5p1zDwUQqhMYhT7g.text: The wait is a little long but worth it! Good food and awesome kpop music. Give a review and free soda :)

FWM_UiUTyrKPvfEOmSCTng.text: Great all you can spot!  The meat is abundant and marinade is on point. The Shit is an amazing appetizer.

QXBofqKt06U_X0uU9c-xaw.text: Great food and service! Highly recommend this place. Recommend the brisket, short rib. They got all types of meat. The environment is clean and great vibes. Better than most restaurants in china town

-CSe0czdBBP6UtpFnZ9LWg.text: I've been to this place for quite a while now, so I decided now is the best time to finally make a review.  Food is great & they have such a wide selection of appetizer & meat, so be sure to have an empty stomach before coming in here! I love their red wine pork belly, as well as their skirt steak.  Their customer service, however, is such a hit or miss. The past three visits for me has been such a disappointment. I understand if it's a busy night & all, but to forget an order & not checking in if we need water? It was annoying, but it's good that they were checking in on other customers except us  We had no water, empty plates were piling up, being gone for most of our dinner, & having to find you = not acceptable in my book. But thank you for your quick service as soon as we asked for dessert.

fihJHe7-fzA-kUZnH1Y8kw.text: Best KBBQ I've ever been to, and definitely the best value for the money. The wait is long and the repetitive door opening make the wait very hot. But the food makes it all worth it. Try the ribeye and baby octopus

bjE6FekVmX_QCHPr3eFUNg.text: This was my second time to Hwaro. The first time I was here was last year. I discovered Hwaro since I browsing on Yelp to find a good Korean BBQ and of course, Yelpers didn't let me down. We went as a group of 4 in 2015 for dinner. We do the all day special which is only $3 more but you will have short ribs (without bones - can request bones-in if you want), and other specialty.  The quality is really good. I like all the side dishes. They are generous with salad to balance the meaty. They also have some items that is not served or offer at Omi or Jin in Dallas. I find out about pork cheek, which a type of bacon but more buttery and chewy. They marinated the meat very well. If you ever want a steak, come here and choose the premium steak, they literally brought out a 12 oz ribeye steak. Oh my god!! I was rolling my eyes. Since the recent time I only went with a friend, I told the waitress that she should only bring us a little of each items so we can try more items. However, I still feel it was too much for me because of their generous portion.  They have very good potato salad. My friend was on a low carb diet but after trying the potato salad, she order 2 more. That was how good it is.  I especially like the intestines, which I'm sure many people here find disgusting. But to be honest, Hwaro did a very good job of cleaning and marinated. It does not have that kind of smell and all was very fatty and crunchy. Don't over order this item even though you like it, it's very fatty and unhealthy. Just eat a little bit to satisfy your craving and move on their other delicious items!  Oh, and you guys should always try the Sh!t (lolz), yup, a very memorable named item on the menu. Limit 1 per table. For me, it's ok but the name stays on my mind till now.  I'll make my way back to Hwaro each time I come back to Vegas for sure

Friendly staff. And Great Food.   The Only negative/con of this place is because of all the stoves it gets alittle hot inside. Best time to go during the summer is after the sun goes down.

ZXykr-8D09NNOtfFMJchtw.text: Our go to Korean bbq place.  Great sides fast service.  Briskets hit or miss sometimes comes out frozen and it sticks to the grill but everything else pretty much on point. Recommended orders: Shake shake rice Skirt steak Short ribs Beef bulgogi ( sliced ribeye ) Kfc

FYJPIK4AmDRMsIi6yzmWMw.text: The wait was worth it for this AYCE Korean BBQ for $23. One of my top restaurants, and off the strip! Try the "shit" which is a special that is off the hook. Favorites included the brisket, short rib, premium steak (1 per person limit), pork belly, and the pineapple marinated steak. The meat was all high quality, everything was Recommend an uber there, parking is the worst thing ever.  If you haven't had Korean BBQ before, the table has a grill in the middle and they bring you the meat to cook yourself! Start off with a big order, so you can eat as you cook. The server will help explain it! Fun experience, awesome food!

TqZNuSCHs2b1oncgu0ygyA.text: the pictures you see on yelp is a reflection of the place itself! a complete and utter disappointment as a first timer! we were constantly reminded that our time was up or has expired by our server only having been sat down no more than 1 hour, our dining experience were the most horrific that we have no words to describe other than caveat WARNING OR DINE AT YOUR OWN RISK! did'nt even have a chance to finish our dinner let alone choose our desert, let alone everything else on our table. We were constantly reminded every 2 to 3 minutes that they have other guest waiting outside and that they like to entertain them as well. long story short, from my perspective 9 out of every 10 customers that leaves HWARO is no doubt with an indigestive stomach or with ulcer! HIGHLY GO ELSEWHERE FOR THE EXPERIENCE AND WHORTH WHILE. Bon a petit.

Jfje80Ts1-p_Fcb3rVZn-w.text: This is my favorite AYCE KBBQ place!!!! Hands down.  2nd cheapest AYCE KBBQ in town but meat/menu selection is 100% times better than the cheapest place in town. Not exaggerating this place has 40+ things on their menu. While the cheapest one has 15+  items on their menu - i will up date these numbers for more accuracy next time.  Currently $19(happy hour) and $22(regular hour).  Meat Quality: 7/10.... My 10/10 meat quality KBBQ places are usually not AYCE. However, there is only one AYCE KBBQ with better meat quality than this place, all others are equall or below Hwaro. So, it actually is a 9/10 quality among AYCE KBBQ.  My only problem is, this place almost always has a loooooong line during meal times.. but that proves how popular this place is.

rSViNkkLddhi_JjUwwf3MA.text: Great food and atmosphere. The appetizers are great! So many to chose from. "The Shit" is absolutely delicious!  The meat is good but the appetizers make this place better. The service is always good even when they are busy.

TU4qleXUh5_r7pp2N5TBCg.text: My favorite Korean bbq place! The service is always great and the meat is the best quality I've ever had at Korean bbq. I always get the premium all you can eat and each time we get more than our money's worth. Sometimes the wait can get up to over an hour but it's definitely worth it. If you're wanting to try Korean bbq, go here first.

j3i4Hq3Ag0qN9XyUEZbWKA.text: Yummy yummy in my tummy! This place has really good quality meat, and for the price, everything is such a great deal. When I come here, I always order the steamed egg (which I adore), brisket, pork belly, skirt steak, and spicy skirt steak. I tend to order the same things when I go to Korean BBQ, but I really like this place because the meats have excellent marbling, and you can really tell that the quality of the meat is superior. This is by far one of my favorite places to get Korean BBQ, and I would highly recommend it.

We had Galbi, bulgogi, pork belly and the spicy pineapple skirt steak. Also, the shake shake rice, steamed egg and the soy bean paste soup. Everything we tried was so tasty. The  s**t is my favorite item they have and I usually order a ridiculous amount of it when I'm there.   My only issue is that I usually have to wait at least 40 minutes to be seated. With how much business they're bringing in, I wish they could relocate to a bigger location.   Nothing beats Hwaro!

I would go there again to eat their food and their amazing ice cream. The only thing I didn't like there was the wait to go inside, but other than that everything was great for me.

7VN_kxfv5JhtBt5rkgIZpQ.text: Really love coming here. Everyone is always so friendly. The pork belly is my favorite!!! Definitely try it!

NVaJq1effa8ae7qIsnch9A.text: I am SO SO SO SO happy to have found this place. Coming from Southern California, Korean Barbecue is everywhere.. and usually it's all you can eat at a decent price. I have lived here two years and this is the first place to remind me of home. They offer so much on their menu, it's actually WAY more than I've ever seen.. and all at the all you can eat price!   There are a couple downsides. One being the wait, but it was during the weekend so as long as you are prepared to wait, you'll be okay. And two, the music was so loud! I felt like I was at a club! Other than that, this place is amazing, staff is friendly and I will definitely be back again!!

_r_8ZO4gtYxTJt9lWLQHnQ.text: I love Hwaro! I've been here in a large group, on dates, small groups, with my kids. And I've gone every time of the day.  Every time I've come here the staff is always fun and friendly.  I've never had a hint of a bad attitude, and sometimes if I'm dancing or singing to a song they will join in. (Only a couple times though) They always treat my daughter well and give her ice cream, even though she's 3 and gets to eat for free.  The food there is amazing, all the other kbbq places in Vegas are a dollar or two more, and don't have the selection that Hwaro provides. (besides Gen as they are the same price and both have large selections.) They also have the best range of appetizers you can get at a kbbq place, and they are well known for them.   For the price of the dinner and the value of the food, this place is well worth giving a try.  And it shows with how busy they are nights & weekends.  I will sit and wait for an hour after fighting people in the parking lot for a spot thats how good Hwaro is!

Bs_hPWnxTAJ-GxlsbSsTnw.text: Our go to K BBQ in town... good pricing and fast service! Always full when you leave this place! Good short ribs and DA SHIT is a go to for apps

0KzgqSbB1-EY_cXPOIRyTw.text: This is honestly probably the best KBBQ I have ever had. I've been to many but this definitely tops it off. Whenever I go, there is barely a wait time. I go usually during the week but on The weekend it's pretty busy which is normal for any restaurant. When you sit at the table, they display all the side items for you before you even sit down - which is super nice. It's honestly amazing and the customer service is so great. I love coming here and I recommend this place to anyone!

Opan4g8X4ZpMYG-FiXOLvg.text: One of my favorite food is Korean BBQ.  I experience several Korean BBQs around Las Vegas and have my own preferences to a good Korean BBQ.  Hwaro, another Korean BBQ restaurant that offers one menu where you can order various meat. They supply many side dishes like many KBBQ restaurants such as Radish Warp, Cheese Corn, and etc.  Before, the restaurant had a different name called Korean Delicious or something similar to that name.  I'm not sure if it's the same establishment or if they changed it, but now it is called Hwaro.  You cook the meat yourself like many other KBBQ restaurants, and we  ordered meat for example, Beef Tongue, Brisket, and Pork Belly.  The first time I went, we also ordered Shake Shake Rice, where you actually shake the container to mix up the rice with egg.  In Korean, it is called Dosirakwhich means LunchBox. After the shake, the yolk mixes with the rice, gochujang, and other ingredients.  I'm weak to spiciness so it was a little spicy to me, but if you can deal with spiciness then you'll love it if you also love egg and rice.  It's a fun way to make the dish~  I've seen Shake Shake Rice only in videos from Korea or different state, so I was excited that I was able to experience the Shake Shake Rice. UPDATE (September 2018) They don't serve the Shake Shake Rice anymore, but they have Hwaro House Rice which is similar, but without the tin box.  My friend had been there before and she told me that the Steamed Egg had an after taste of Cheese to her.  After I tried the dish, I taste a little bit of Cheese as a aftertaste.  It seemed more well cooked compare to the other Steamed Egg I had where you can see more of the broth.  They give you a good amount of meat, so you do not feel overwhelm with all the meat.  When I went, you had to write your name on the list if they have lots of people waiting.  It was a nice lively place, it can be a bit loud, but the Food was Delicious~ For Dessert, I ordered the Matcha Ice Cream.

M7sl9Z6gvb1VdslPRQ7JvA.text: Been here quite often, love their kbbq and love their brisket sauce. Prices are understandable however service can be a tad bit better, was a few times when I would order a drink and have to ask for it again or have dishes missing. Quality of meat is pretty standard and you do get a large variety of choices for the price. PARKING as always is a pain here and you should expect at least 5 mins or more just searching for an open stall. Please do not park on the sides of the walls or unmarked areas as I have seen cars getting hit that were parked in places they shouldn't have been. Be prepared for an additional wait as there is almost always at least a 30 minute wait time for this place so note that in advance  Overall though place is good and will be here pretty often :D

8xVbnhDwd80xENzHjcmltw.text: I had a bad experience the first time I came here and avoided the place for the longest time. I heard that they had a change in ownership so I decided to give this place another try. I've been here a few times in the past few months and it's a lot better than my first experience but does not top some other Korean BBQ places I've been to. Although I do have to say that this spot is great for late night owls and the price is pretty reasonable for the quality.

jamb6e3Hd6doSXXg7r26Sg.text: I love coming here. I frequent this establishment at least once or twice a month. My experience every time is awesome. There are times where you have to wait to get in up to an hour but now with their new system that alerts you where you are in line makes it better.

nHRIEhV0bcjv2qJjmYTRRA.text: For the price of an ayce kbbq, this place is probably your best bet. Yeah it's not the greatest quality of meat but from every other ayce kbbq place I been to, this place makes it worth the money. The biggest thing I probably don't like about this place is probably just the wait time because of how busy it always gets. I usually have to wait 45 mins to an hour everytime I go just to get seated so I wish they expanded a bit. Even with that, I always come back though!

uEjHub928pHg9izCsPGcVw.text: Having been to Gyukaku, Yagyu(closed), Honey Pig, Tofu Hut, Korean Garden BBQ House, Sura and Gangnam, I feel like Hwaro is just another mediocre addition to AYCE BBQ spots in Vegas.   SERVICE  Best one by far, compared to other BBQ spots around town. We had about 3 servers constantly checking on us. All of them were friendly and attentive. Thumbs up for their service!  CLEANLINESS  Took a star off of this. I understand it is difficult to deal with oily stuff. Table was all oily but that's expected (I would appreciate if they took more time wiping the table). What I can't stand was the floor covered in oil. One of the server slipped by our table because of how oily the floor was. We had multiple servers telling us to watch out the step and I was scared getting up from the table. The floor was so slippery! Perhaps wood floor is a bad idea for BBQ place? Or they just have to clean more? I don't know how they can solve this but they definitely need to do something about it before someone gets hurt. My tip would be to wear a slip-resistant shoes. Any shoes with grip will work.   FOOD Another star off. We ordered short ribs, marinated pork and brisket. Nothing spectacular. You get banchan like any other KBBQ place. I would say the quality of the meat didn't match the price. Considering Tohu Hut has a late night special for $13.99 AYCE, I would much rather deal with their rude  service than to pay over $20 for AYCE BBQ that is about the same quality, if not Hwaro is slightly better. I also wouldn't mind paying a little extra and go to Gyukaku, Honey Pig or Korean BBQ House for better quality meat.   CONCLUSION I wouldn't mind giving them a second chance but there's definitely a better AYCE BBQ options in Vegas so this place wouldn't be my first choice. Quality wise, Gangnam, Honey Pig and Gyukaku would be my top choices. Tohu Hut or Hwaro if you are feeling broke/just want to get your BBQ craving satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. $19.99 AYCE KBBQ. Located between Raku and Monta Ramen.

n-NhP95fHlBaGws34kFJzg.text: Hwaro will now be my AYCE KBBQ spot when I'm in town. Came here on Sunday afternoon, 20 min wait, not too bad. They have a wide variety of appetizers and meat which are all deliciously flavored. The shake shake rice is definitely a must try, as stated on their menu. I will definitely be coming back and recommending this place to family/friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Yummy shake shake rice

YVZt-QWRapl56n3O15E5ow.text: This place is AWESOME! Service is always friendly and quick. Sometimes later at night you might wait awhile for a table, but it's totally worth it. They have actually added quite a few more tables in the last couple months. Overall, the BEST AYCE KBBQ in town.  Pricing: all day special $20.95 per person (I recommend this no matter what time of day). Lunch/Late Night Special $17.95 per person.  Short ribs, short ribs, short ribs. That's one of the BEST things on the menu.   Other menu favourites: Potato Salad Corn Cheese and Garlic Butter Gyoza Brisket SHORT RIBS! - my personal favourite Spicy Pineapple Beef Steak  (not too spicy) Bean paste soup - excellent and piping hot, also spicy.  The new menus say there's a time limit, but it's really not enforced so don't mind that. Sodas are canned and $1.50 each, which is a bummer, but with all the different flavours I always chug the water anyway. Groups of 4 or more are charged a 15% "service fee" and you can't fly solo here, probably due to its popularity.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Menu 08/30/16.
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Front of menu. 08/30/16

aGGrPwKwkvg2i2XlzL35gA.text: I really like this place. I book marked it a couple of months ago and stopped by to try something different from Tofu Hut or Sura. I was happy I did.  Everyone knows what an AYCE KBBQ place is. What makes this place different? They have about 8-10 BBQ seating sets. They have a large variety of meats that are unique from other places. Example? They have wine marinated pork belly, green tea marinated pork belly, and marinated baby octopus. They bring out the soup and steamed egg without request and they have a large variety of sides. One of the sides they bring out is cheesy cream corn that gets heated on the grill! The two times I've been there the service was good. The staff is nice and they actually have a lot of workers.   At all of the different KBBQ places there are things I don't like. I either don't like their meat, their sides, or their service. I just like it here. Since you cook your own most places don't come by much so it's hard to get refills, napkins, ect.  I just like this place. They have your utensils and napkins on the table in a container. They give you a pitcher of water so you don't need the server for refills. Their meat selection is not only large but tasty. You won't get bored. Plus the price is right. I was scared to post a review because I like not having to wait for a spot but the secret is out.

DVSbQyB5dm-C0JmDUEqYGA.text: Went this past Saturday. 30 minute wait, but so worth the wait. Super attentive staff. Food was fabulous. Love The Shit (an appetizer of awesomeness). I liked cooking our meat at the table. If I have one issue is that I wish they would explain what ALL the meat selections are. But that is a super small thing. I must say I was so happy with our choice on where to go for dinner. Can't wait to go again.

aXZBE3W3LbrNuA7iiVufAQ.text: This is my boyfriend and I's favorite kbbq place! The ayce price is pretty cheap for the quality of meat that you get! Our go-to is the brisket. The skirt steak and the premium steak is always great too! We can't go more than two weeks without stopping by at this point!   The meat is always fantastic and the service is normally pretty fast. They are really good to ask if you would like more meat and they change the grills frequently. This is hands down our go to place for Korean BBQ!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Brisket on the grill
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. The cheese fondue!

FupcfpwVf6PI1UD7CWdXpA.text: $19.99 for All You Can Eat (AYCE) Korean BBQ (KBBQ)? Hell to the yes!   This place offers quality grilled meats at a huge value! The all you can eat deal is definitely the way to go; the meal is actually a feast and comes with a few complimentary dishes, but I wouldn't sweat trying to force down everything, especially if meat is on your agenda. They also offer a good variety of traditional banchan (side dishes) that all tasted fresh and authentic. Our favorites were the kimchi and the bean sprouts - both extremely flavorful! You can also request some garlic and jalapenos to grill up! That's our favorite thing to do and pairs deliciously with grilled meat.   Of all meats we tried, I preferred the meats from the non-marinated "plain" section, I found them to be fresh and I loved being able to dip them in the table sauces and control my salt intake. The pre-marinated meats were a tad too salty for me. Make sure to try half-portions of the meat so that you have room to try more! Luckily my friend Philip T. gave us this tip, so we didn't have to break our bellies to try everything.   Here's what we tried:  *Pork shoulder butt - unbelievably buttery! I loved dipping this in the sesame oil salt 5/5  * Hwaru pork belly - super thin pork belly that looks like bacon! Flavor was very buttery and slightly sweet. 5/5  *Marinated pork rib - great flavor and very juicy meat, but maybe too chewy for me 3/5  *Short rib (bone) - great meaty flavor and juicy, but this one was also a tad too chewy for my preference 3/5   *Sweet spicy pork - very tender and nice sweet and spicy flavor, yet it was a little too salty for us 4/5  *Spicy baby back ribs - tender and super meaty again, slightly too salty for us 4/5  Complimentary sides: * Doenjang Jjigae (Korean fermented soybean paste stew) - traditional and very comforting! I loved sipping the hot broth 5/5  * Gyeran jjim (Korean steamed fluffy egg casserole) - super fluffy! 5/5  * Salad - simple but fresh with a tangy light dressing. Great balance to all of the meat! 4/5  * Corn cheese - A traditional bar type food, with average flavor 3/5  * Pumpkin sikhye - chilled sweet pumpkin dessert drink. It's simple, but a great palate cleanser after all of that meat! 4/5  We really adored the waitress who tended our table, cooking our meat for us; she was very friendly, helpful and informative. Plus the overall service was extremely prompt and polite from the entire staff during our dinner. Any sides or sauces we needed were refilled immediately with no down time. We also enjoyed the trendy ambiance and all of the nerdy comics and posters scattered about. We really felt that they appreciated us for dining there and that left a great first impression on us! I've only had a handful of KBBQ dining experiences in Las Vegas, but I honestly think this one has been my favorite so far! I'm already thinking about what I'm going to try the next time I visit.

luhman87t9_egccJT0DCsg.text: I would say one of the better kbbq spots in comparison with other spots in Vegas. No where else.  Positives:  -Fresh meat -Recommend: Skirt steak. Juicy, even when cooked medium well. -Variety of appetizers: -Kfc chicken was my favorite  -"The shit" was a second runner up. I'm not quite sure what it was that they put inside but I believe it was some type of meat or shrimp since it tastes similar to fried seaweed shrimp rolls they have at many dim-sum place  -Food quality matches the price, we paid about $22 each (which is still a little much) for a party of 7.   Negatives: -Just like many Korean bbq places: Service. -They closed down the kitchen, without giving us last call. Made us disappointed because my boyfriend was unable to get ice cream & I did 5 minutes before him. Also because it was only 1AM & they close @ 3AM. Sucks. -Includes gratuity for parties of 4 or more. -Very unfortunate that they didn't nail the brisket. -They also don't carry brisket sauce.  -Many of the appetizers included on the menu that we wanted, (brisket nachos & I forgot the other one) they didn't have. -Also didn't have the other ice cream flavors listed on the menu, only green tea. -They don't have an extensive menu for the "special" menu. I.E: Beef tongue only included for lunch.  Overall, 3/5 experience. They should look into telling customers what they do & do not have before ordering.

5bK--ksC8vCxIeFL-wd5wA.text: I'm a Vegas local and i LOVE this spot to eat! Top three in my list! You want all you can eat BEEF? Come to Hwaro! And visit Jitto! He is the best server there and will make you feel like a king! Best service and fantastic food! You can't get better than this....

XvWnGM4rtXlhNSUg1MC5dQ.text: Best value for ayce kbbq in town. Thickest cuts of meat and with tasty seasonings. Also they have interesting menu items aside from the ayce meats. 7lu3PWlRX9L70z6qj5h0ow.text: Been meaning to check out this KBBQ spot for a while now because there always seems to be a line out the door whenever I see it across the street from when I visit Snowflake Shavery.  It wasn't very busy when we arrived and had about 3 parties ahead of us waiting for a table. The greeters were very short and told us to sit down at what already looked like a table where we would be eating so it seemed unclear as to whether we were waiting for service or just a table.  We waited about 25 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us and we were ushered to our table. Our waiter was very nice and checked on us fairly often. The food was great. The marination and flavor of the meats were great and the selection of the appetizers were numerous. The chicken was so soft and melted in my mouth. When I asked for a refill of the fish cakes, I got a plate double the size of the original filled with fish cake.   Great spot for the food, but I don't think I would come back here considering how long I would have to wait. There are plenty of other Korean BBQ places I could go to with a significantly shorter wait time and better service.

wEqjTizCRy3SyiHujc1i0g.text: Great selection of meats. Affordable price for all you can eat kbbq. Appetizers are great. Lots of veggie options which is always a plus

rwWoXWETBw6K3W5inNchAw.text: Delicious. Didn't blow me away, wouldn't say it's the best ramen place in Vegas but for the price, I won't complain. Great service and food comes out very fast.

Q7t7kX4dhBbQxqcBeKUaSQ.text: Tried this place for the first time today. I got there a little early (around 5: 30pm or so)  so there wasn't a long wait for us to be seated. I like the set up of the restaurant.  For it being a small place,  it isn't overly crowded or anything.  The presentation when you're first seated is nice too.  I wasnt expecting there to be sides on the table already. The things I really liked was the spicy pork bulgolgi and  the steamed egg. 'The shit' was pretty bomb too. I wasnt a fan of the beef skirt although they recommend it. It was a big portio,  but I wasn't impressed by it.    Service was really good. The staff are very attentive. The price was good for AYCE too.  It was a little over $24 with taxes.  I'd go again whenever I crave Korean BBQ.

uOdmdWLTIJ-b207oFm6NEg.text: Not bad, Hwaro!   I'll be honest, the first time I came to Hwaro I left before ordering... Due to an "unfortunate circumstance" they were not serving any alcohol. I was with two of my Korean friends who wanted soju and were very disappointed they couldn't order alcohol. We left and ventured off to Woonamjung's further down Spring Mountain for AYCE KBBQ and multiple bottles of soju.  I was bummed about leaving because I've been wanting to try Hwaro and heard nothing but good things from my Korean coworkers. I finally tried Hwaro this week and was not disappointed!   The salad that comes with the KBBQ tasted average. On the other hand, the banchan was on point! Pretty tasty! A nice variety of side dishes were provided and the servers were nice about replenishing them when requested.   Servers came by our table frequently - at least 4 different people visited throughout our dinner. They were fantastic and quickly fulfilled our requests (water, sauces, additional side dishes, etc). We were never waiting and they even came by to change out our grill.   For meat, I'm all about the brisket and don't crave anything else (kalbi, bulgogi, pork belly, etc). My friend I was with ordered all sorts of meat selections ranging from cuts of flank steak, intestine, to pork skin. I enjoyed the brisket... It was fatty (which I ate around) but also very tender. The flank was great and the intestine was interesting. I didn't try the pork skin but my friend enjoyed it. I also didn't try any of the marinated meat so unfortunately I can't speak for the kalbi or bulgogi.   Hwaro gets 4 stars from me. The banchan and prompt service gets a 5. Both were much better than some of the Korean AYCE BBQ restaurants I've been to in the city. The meat gets a 3.5. I enjoyed my experience at Hwaro and would definitely consider coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. First round of meat ordered
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Banchan for days!

RyIgXhQ-BNblMAZWo17Gyg.text: Hwaro has been my number one choice for AYCE KBBQ in Las Vegas for about 3 years now and for good reason. Although the crowds around the late evening are expected, I was happy with the updated wait system. The hostess has you enter your name and phone number onto a tablet and your are sent a text with an estimated wait time. A link is also provided to see where you are at in the waiting line. This is a huge improvement from the typical pen and paper sign in they used to have as you have the freedom to do something while you wait as opposed to sitting their waiting for your name to be called because you did not want to be skipped over. As usual, the service was fantastic. Our waiter this visit was Jitto and he was attentive, friendly, and made the overall experience better than any other Hwaro experience I have had before. Onto the food. For the appetizers, we ordered the Shake Shake Rice and The Shit (Crab meat wrapped in seaweed and deepfried, MUST TRY), and corn cheese. We ordered rice paper and a lot of the potato salad side dish as well. Hwaro seems to do their potato salad differently but in a delicious way! For the meats, we ordered brisket, pork shoulder, beef belly, spicy pork bulgogi, bulgogi, premium steak, and skirt steak. We ordered several servings of each meat of course. The marinated meat all tasted delicious and didn't taste too saucy. Everything we ordered tasted delicious, it's KBBQ! Another fantastic Hwaro trip and we'll be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States. Shake Shake Rice
Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

53ZBxf26JxVb5JksV-6v4A.text: Hwaro stepped it up on my recent visit with service and food turned into 4 stars! The "All You Can Eat" Korean BBQ hits the spot. Workers gave quick and friendly service... they were all definitely on point. This restaurant has great quality meats with 3 dipping sauces along with plentiful fresh sides! I also like how they give you a container of water so you can refill your glass which is cool. My faves here are the: bulgogi, brisket, and pork belly!! Yummy yummy.~

-aSwlJUWCG3JCw-lniNWjA.text: The place was super clean and nice, much more than I expected at an AYCE bbq place. The staff there were so nice and welcoming. We came on a Friday night so of course there was a wait but it was well worth it. Upon our seating, they already had the banchan, water, and grill ready to make up for the wait.  I'm a fan of beef tongue and I was so happy there portions were generous; Actually all their portions of meat were generous. They had multiple choices of banchan which were all so yummy! For their desserts, we had the red bean and plum ice cream. Both were very interesting.  When my boyfriend and I come to Las Vegas for another vacation, we'd definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hwaro - Spring Valley, NV, United States

BFg5qC2M99Ny8uUR73WuAg.text: Hwaro used to be our go to place, but last week my boyfriend and i came back since we haven't had kbbq in awhile. And it was only our second time ordering, when the server only served us one serving of meat when we asked for two servings as we were still hungry, but this server told us how she didn't want to bring us alot as we might not finish it and we have to pay for it? We are there to eat, and we will pay if we dont finish it if anything? I dont think thats even right to say to your customers. AFTER THAT SERVING I LITERALLY LOST MY APPETITE AND DIDN'T ORDER ANYMORE. I used to love this place, we used to go here every other week, but as the service is getting bad i wouldn't recommend it anymore. I used to tell my friends to go here as the food are really great as well as the employees but as time goes by its just getting worse!

sxXPs3b5vl7PupsvvxRYrw.text: Great service from Rino! All the food was delicious and the whole group enjoyed themselves. Will be coming back again!

OveS8oUldY7aHYkHsmiroA.text: So happy I was finally able to make a trip down here after how many visits to Vegas. What was supposed to be a trip to Kung Fu Tea (also amazing) turned into having dinner here. Yes, the wait may have been a hour for 2 people on a Thursday night, but what do you expect during the holidays?   The quality of the meat didn't leave me feeling nauseous like other all you can eat KBBQ restaurants, service was spectacular even though they were crazy packed. Never once did I feel neglected or forgotten and we were sat in the back corner. The $22.95 price can't be beat for 56 dinner items, you can't go there and not find something that you like. And when they say "must try" you don't ignore that. The shake shake rice was AH-MAZE-ING. I could have cared less for "The Shit" but only because I'm not a fan of shellfish. My friend loved it though so that's confirmation enough that it's The Shit, haha.   I'm not too sure if it's because I live in Hawaii and we have yet to experience AYCE KBBQ like the west coast, but my mind seems to be blown every time I take a trip to the mainland.

afzG8qDaEkL0jn4lGO9wvQ.text: Hwaro has been on my radar since it opened a while ago. I think that their menu has a better selection than most KBBQ joints in Chinatown. The interior is spacious, and they even have tables that specifically accommodate smaller parties. In my case, my friend and I got an area of the restaurant that has a "private room" feel to it because of the dividers separating us from other people dining in.  The meat did not look questionable in quality, which made me feel better about going all out here. The pork and squid take the longest to cook, but they're SO worth it. I suggest getting the fast-cooking items, like the brisket, while you wait for the other things to cook so you're not waiting hungry.  A few notable items on their menu were:  The spicy chicken: it had a unique flavor that's hard to describe with words and it wasn't too spicy for my palate. There's no need to dip it in any sauce because it's already flavorful as is.  The butter fly (the shoulder part of pork): like I said before, pork is the longest cooking item on the menu. You can't be too careful with pork, so we let it cook for a while. It's savory & tender without the overbearing fat flavor.  The enoki beef: this is my FAVORITE thing on their menu. The beef was tender and had the melt-in-your-mouth factor to it. The mushrooms enhanced the flavor even more, giving it a richer flavor. It's a shame that it's only one order per person because this is the best tasting thing I've ever had at a Korean BBQ place!  With friendly service, quality menu items at a decent price, and a spacious & modern interior you can't beat it! This is hands down my new favorite KBBQ place in Chinatown.

nsG3a8Tr-uw_oXTYcWhsXw.text: Hwaro ... under new management.  AYCE (all you can eat) BBQ $17 for lunch or $20 for dinner .. not a bad price.    WARNING :  if you're 21 and older and looking to have a drink, you gotta wait.  They are in the process of renewing their liquor license ... ugh (they would've got another star,  but I couldn't drink with my meal .. major party foul).   The food and service is good.  They weren't really busy when we were there so if we needed anything it was easy to get someone's attention.  One thing is they have some not so common names on the menu like "act like a Korean", which was spicy ribs lol or "fat ass" marinated pork belly.      Another change is no dessert, which they had before ... but I'm ok with that.  We are usually way too stuffed to fit in dessert.    Also if you never been to AYCE Korean BBQ be prepared to smell like it all the way home ... hahaha

The staff is pretty friendly, they are pretty quick with the grill changes. The selection of meats are awesome! The flavors are not to salty and just the right amount of spice. xZS6V9k5dqVO-l9ASbvv5A.text: ** If you write a review here, you get a free beer or drink, but I still stand by my review and I would come back. Also, I didn't even finish my beer.  **  Came in at about 10:45 pm on a Friday night. The wait was about 10 minutes. Not that bad. Busy / crowded parking lot.  I came back to the same plaza the next night and there were a lot of people waiting outside, so maybe we just got really lucky. Not sure if they take reservations, but write your name down when you go in.  The lettuce and veggie bowl are both pretty good. Lots of side dishes for you. And an all you can eat menu. :~) Yay!!  For lunch and late nights, there's an all you can eat buffet menu for $17.95, which is amazing!! To eat everything on the menu, it's $20.95.  The meat is really good and they change the metal plate for you every time. Also order their shake shake rice!! Really good, but not one order per table. They have so many options to choose from.  Things that we've ordered so far:  - Green tea smoked pork belly (Didn't taste the green tea but it was still good) - Regular pork belly - Brisket (Yum!) - Hwaro Spicy Pork Rib (Also yum!) - The Shit (Ugh, sooo good. I thought we were limited to only one, but I misread the menu. Getting more of these next time. Also the sauce is amazinggg.) - Shake shake rice (Get this too)  I think we order about 8 meats for 2 people and we were stuffed after. My bf ended up eating a lot of white rice LOL. It was his first time eating KBBQ.  Out of all the KBBQ's I've eaten in my life, this place is one of my favorites.  Customer service is pretty good. A bit hard to get the waiter's attention sometimes, but I think it's partly because there's more tables than employees.  Also, get dessert. Because why not???
